events.name: Consumer Tech Bowling - Founders & Investors
events.description: Consumer Tech Bowling: Founders & Investors Consumer Tech Bowling brings together top tier founders, investors & marketing leaders in the consumer tech space for an evening of focused conversations & strategic interactions. The structured yet relaxed atmosphere ensures that you'll engage with the right people while discussing the trends & challenges shaping consumer tech. This event is tailored for: Consumer Tech Founders - Whether you're building an app or a platform, this is a chance to meet others navigating similar growth challenges. Investors - Meet early-stage & scaling consumer tech startups, discover new investment opportunities, & engage with the founders shaping the future of consumer tech. Marketers & Growth Experts - Exchange strategies on product growth, customer acquisition, & scaling in a competitive market. Product Leaders - Discuss trends in consumer behavior, product adoption, & engagement while gaining direct insights from other leaders in the field.  What Makes This Special?This event is designed to drive organic engagement. The focus is on creating opportunities for direct interaction & shared insights in a fun setting.  Consumer tech is a fast-moving space - growth strategies are constantly evolving, customer expectations are shifting, & competition is fierce. This is a rare opportunity to engage directly with others facing similar challenges & uncover new strategies through friendly conversations.  Included with Your RSVP:Complimentary bowling - scores are optional, but the fun isn't! Food & beverages - Enjoy drinks & refreshments throughout the event while engaging with fellow attendees. Targeted conversations - We'll ensure that you connect with the right people based on your role & goals.  Agenda 6:00 PM - 6:30 PM: Settle-in - check-in, shoes, mingling 6:30 PM - 7:30 PM: Bowling - fun & friendly 7:30 PM - 8:00 PM: Mingling - chill conversations  In Partnership with Law by LevinThis event is hosted in partnership with Law by Levin - A Boutique Firm Built for the Innovation Economy. At Law by Levin, we understand the unique challenges & opportunities in the startup ecosystem. We provide tailored legal representation for founders, companies & venture capital investors.  RSVP Now - Limited Spots Available!Bowling lanes fill up fast, & this event is designed to stay intimate enough to facilitate meaningful interactions. Don't miss your chance to engage with consumer tech game-changers - sign up now to secure your spot!  This event is hosted by Fun Meets. Fun Meets is NYC's largest community of consumer tech founders, marketers & investors. We help consumer tech startups get the education & opportunities they need to build, grow, & scale their companies, all while having fun. Excited to see you soon!Fun Meets team

events.name: Ethics & Equity - Navigating Inclusive Excellence In Healthcare & Health Research
events.description: Join us on March 25, 2025, for Ethics & Equity: Navigating Inclusive Excellence in Healthcare & Health Research. This one-day conference will explore critical issues in creating a more inclusive & equitable healthcare & research ecosystem. Critical discussions will build trust through representation by engaging communities & refining research practices, developing ethical & equitable strategies to diversify the biomedical research workforce, & ensuring fairness & ethical rigor in clinical trials. This event provides a collaborative platform among speakers & panelists across academia, industry, government, non-profits, & more to exchange knowledge on ethical responsibilities within healthcare & biomedical research. Don't miss this opportunity to connect with leaders in the field.

events.name: Mind The Tech Conference
events.description: Innovate. Deliver. Impact2  Days10 Events800 Attendees50 Speakers80 Investors100 Startups200 B2B Meetings Calcalist returns to New York for its annual Mind the Tech NY conference, focusing on the new challenges facing the Israeli high-tech industry & the global tech sector. Renowned for its resilience, entrepreneurial spirit, & adaptability, the Israeli tech industry continually demonstrates an ability to navigate & recover. The conference will emphasize innovation as a key driver of economic resilience during crises, exploring the potential synergy between artificial intelligence & human ingenuity. This exclusive event will bring together the Israeli high-tech community & its American counterparts for a dynamic two-day experience. Through a series of impactful discussions, thought-provoking keynotes, & curated networking opportunities, participants will gain insights into cutting-edge innovations, explore promising investment avenues, & forge meaningful connections with global leaders shaping the future of technology & innovation.

events.name: LDV Vision Summit
events.description: 15+ fantastic speakers will be sharing their insights on state-of-the-art computer vision, machine learning, & AI solutions aimed at improving the world we live in! Since its inception in 2014, our Annual LDV Vision Summit has been the premier global gathering in visual tech & AI. Every year we bring together an impressive array of brilliant speakers, ranging from tech giants to under-the-radar startups, esteemed research labs & leading venture capital firms. Join our free virtual event to get inspired by cutting-edge computer vision, machine learning & AI solutions that are improving the world we live in! Tune in for 2 fireside chats, 8 lightning keynotes & 2 panel discussions. More speakers will be announced soon! TopicsWe will discuss computer vision, computational imaging, machine learning & AI relating to the following sectors:- Materials Science- Agriculture & Food- Circular Economy- Holography (egocentric vision more broadly)- Synthetic Biology- Neuroscience- Longevity- Robotics Who should attend? Computer Vision, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence experts, researchers, professors, students & professionals Media & brand executives interested in enhancing revenue through innovative imaging  technologies & AI-powered products Investors looking for investment opportunities across all sectors Technology executives assessing companies for potential partnerships & acquisitions Journalists, reporters, editors: to get an update on all things visual tech & AI Check out a few articles that relate to our 11th Summit: Visual Technologies Are Fueling the Transition To a Circular Economy Structuring a Sustainable Future: Visual Technology is Advancing the Discovery & Development of New Materials Meta's Matt Uyttendaele on AI for Material Discovery Visual Data is the Crux of AI & Automation for the Future of All Industries Generative AI As A Utility Will Empower SaaS Businesses

events.name: AAPI Female Tech Founders
events.description: Join Antler & Microsoft for Startups for a dinner & panel with AAPI leaders in the NYC tech scene. Inviting AAPI female investors, founders, operators soon to be founders, & all allies of course. See you soon!nOur evening flow togethern5 - 5:45: arrive, meet & mingle, eat sushi & samosasn5:45 - 6:15:  AAPI panel getting to know:Jenny Chao, PR Advisor at Day One VenturesnHeena Purohit, Director of AI Startups at Microsoft for StartupsnKaila Lim, Head of Community at Antlern6:15 - 7: more mingling, sipping bubble teanWho should comenAAPI-identifying female founders & investorsnOur AAPI female allies 100% welcome!!!nWhat's for dinnernnFAQnHow much social energy do I need for this?nSocial battery needs to be ~60% to enjoy because there is mingling before & after the panel but when you need a breather, we have spaces where you can chill, meditate & when you're ready, float back to the mixer.nCan I bring a +1?nAll attendees must be approved RSVPs on this luma.nnMicrosoft for StartupsnMicrosoft for Startups is a program designed to support venture-backed founders accelerate their startup journey. The program provides startups founders with a wealth of resources: access to free Azure credits, pre-built templates to help startups build AI applications quickly & efficiently & go-to-market support to uncover leads as startups grow towards product-market fit.nAntler Residency for FoundersnAntler works with founders through our signature founder residency, adding value immediately, & taking no equity up front. Founders have the opportunity to pitch our Investment Committee to receive a $200k investment for 8%, allowing them to build for 12-18 months rather than attempting to raise before they have real traction. If you have any questions, ask our GPs in our next AMA here.nnnnnnnnnMicrosoft for Startups Consent/Privacy Policy: By joining this event, you consent to Microsofts collection of this data to contact you regarding future startup-related opportunities. events.name: Women Who Network - Smart Money Moves To Secure Your Future
events.description: Join Miss EmpowHer on Tuesday, March 25, from 5:30 PM - 8:30 PM for an exclusive panel & mixer hosted at Rise, created by Barclays! The Agenda 5:30 PM - 6:00 PM: Welcome - Registration, refreshments, mingling 6:00 PM - 6:50 PM: Panel: "How to Manage Money Like the 1%" Learn to build wealth, invest smarter, & secure your financial future with expert insights 7:00 PM - 7:50 PM: Panel: "Proven Strategies to Scale Your Side Hustle" Discover actionable steps to launch & scale your side hustle, from concept to consistent income 7:50 PM - 8:30 PM: Networking Bingo Ditch the awkward small talk! Enjoy this fun, engaging way to connect with fellow attendees Speakers Alex Chung: Investor at Chai Ventures Genever Oppong: CEO & Founder of Black Women Investors Network (BWI) Jemimah Orevaoghene: Investor on Wall Street Stephany Ohaz: Private Equity Sr. Associate at Goldman Sachs Tamara Olavarria: Block Advisors Small Business Certified Tax Analyst Danielle Spencer: Founder of Some Creative Agency & Forbes 30 under 30 Piper Phillips: Entrepreneurial Content Creator & Founder of Self-Employed Mitchie Nguyen: Content Creator & Investor Nabihah Ahmad: Founder of SSQRD & Content Creator Moderators Caitlyn Kumi: Founder of Miss EmpowHer & Forbes 30 under 30 Princess Achobang: Communications Manager at Microsoft Arrival Details Check-in: All attendees must present proof of identification & sign in with ground floor security before proceeding to Rise on the 2nd floor for event guest check-in Ultra VIP Reserved Area: Following check in, find the reserved seating options for Ultra VIP ticket holders. About the Event Join us for an evening of insightful panels & unparalleled networking opportunities. Learn strategies to manage your money like the 1%, unlock the secrets to growing a thriving side hustle, & gain the tools you need to build a secure financial foundation. This isn't just another mixer; it's your launchpad to financial empowerment. Curate your own experience, expand your community, & receive invaluable guidance on your personal & professional journey. Who Should Attend?Professionals, Entrepreneurs, Investors, Creatives, & Industry Leaders You're looking to turn your passions into profitable side hustles or full-time businesses You're seeking to enhance your financial literacy & build long-term wealth Whether you're a beginner or have some financial knowledge, this event provides actionable strategies for all levels What You'll Gain Inspiring Connections: Network with like-minded, ambitious women in an intimate & curated setting, ensuring high-value connections that can propel your career or business forward. Career & Business Elevation: Gain exclusive, actionable insights relevant to your personal or professional growth, allowing you to elevate your career & business. Cross-Industry Networking: Connect with top professionals, creatives, & entrepreneurs across beauty, fashion, tech, finance, & business, providing you with diverse perspectives & opportunities for collaboration. Follow-Up Opportunities: Secure your connections with access to an exclusive attendee directory, enabling you to follow up & maintain relationships long after the event. Ongoing Engagement: Join an event-only LinkedIn group, providing continuous networking & collaboration opportunities, ensuring the relationships you build continue to thrive beyond the event. A Supportive & Empowering Atmosphere: Engage in open & honest conversations about money & financial empowerment Plus (For VIP Tickets Only) Luxury Goodie Bag: VIP attendees receive a premium goodie bag (valued at $100+), from Keys Soulcare!  Bonus: Bring a FriendTo foster this growing community, we encourage you to invite a friend. Let them get a glimpse of the warmth & ambition the Miss EmpowHer community thrives on. Whether they're a passionate leader in their industry or interested in expanding their network - pass this invite along!Please note: Your friend must register for the event to ensure their name is on the guest list. Important Reminders Questions? Reach out to us at contact@missempowher.com. Note: When you attend this event, you enter an area where photography, audio, & video recording may occur. By entering the event premises, you consent to such. By registering, you'll also receive updates on future events directly in your inbox. Must be 21+ to attend FAQs How can I get my company to pay for my Miss EmpowHer event ticket?Many companies offer a learning & development or education budget that may cover the cost of your ticket. When making your request, highlight how attending the event aligns with your role & benefits your company. Demonstrate how the knowledge & connections you gain will contribute to your work. Use our email template. Can entrepreneurs write off networking events as a tax deduction?Yes, entrepreneurs may be able to write off networking events as a tax deduction, subject to specific conditions: Business Purpose: The event must have a business-related purpose (e.g., meeting clients, partners). Recordkeeping: Keep detailed records of the event, attendees, & business purpose. Expense Documentation: Retain receipts for registration fees, travel, & meals. Disclaimer: This information is for general knowledge & should not be considered professional tax advice. Consult a qualified accountant for advice specific to your tax situation & eligibility for deductions. NO-SHOWS/CANCELLATION POLICYNo refunds will be given for cancellations before the event. Thank you for understanding. About Our Event Partner: Rise by Barclays Rise, created by Barclays, is a global community of the world's top innovators working together to create the future of financial services. events.name: Batter Up!
events.description: Let's hang!As a founder, going through the fundraising process can be incredibly frustrating. It takes an amazing amount of time & effort to convince an investor to agree to talk to you. And then, once you pitch your company, sometimes the investor never gets back to you. Or if they do get back to you, oftentimes their rejection doesn't explain WHY they're not interested. All this can leave an entrepreneur feeling frustrated, dejected, & unsure of what can be done to improve in the future. We think this stinks. That's why, on March 25, we're hosting a live pitch event for founders. And it's FREE to attend. Here's how it'll work: RSVP to the event & submit your pitch deck. Up to 6 founders will be picked & have 2.5 minutes to pitch a panel of investors from Hustle Fund's Angel Squad. The investors will ask follow-up questions & offer feedback to the founders.... just like in a real VC meeting! By the end of this event, you'll have a deeper understanding of why investors decide to invest in a company (or not). And the winner takes home a prize   We'll leave some time at the end of the event for your questions... so come curious! Who should come?We designed this event for founders & investors.  If you're a founder looking to get feedback on your pitch, you'll love this. If you're a founder just looking to learn from other founders, we invite you to register without submitting your deck, & come enjoy the show! We promise you'll get some big takeaways. If you're an investor looking to meet more founders, or just hoping to learn more about how to evaluate companies, you'll also get a lot out of Batter Up! Take NoteThis is an in-person event. There is no virtual option. You must be present, in-person, to be eligible to pitch. Applications to pitch will close on Tuesday, Mar 18 at 5pm EST. If you have not submitted your deck by then, you will not be able to pitch. Please be ready with your pitch in case you are selected. The Schedule6pm: Get here, eat pizza, make friends 6:30-8pm: BatterUp! - Pitches from a few founders & investor panel feedback 8-9pm: Finish the pizza, make more friends 9pm: Say goodbye Who's behind this? Hustle Fund is an early stage venture firm that believes great founders can look like anyone & come from anywhere. We invest in startups all over the world & we'd love to see what you're building. Learn more about us.  Angel Squad was created by Hustle Fund for you to Learn, Invest & Network! The impact of the Squad is huge - 1500+ Angels, investing over $23M in 65+ companies. At this event in the Bay Area, you will have the opportunity to attend an IRL pitch event! Learn more about the Squad.  General Assembly is a global pioneer in tech training & talent solutions - from data analytics & data science, to software engineering, UX design, & more. General Assembly helps students launch their tech careers & employers build diverse, scalable tech talent pipelines. Learn more here.

events.name: Learn How To Negotiate A Term Sheet
events.description: Every term sheet is negotiated. Not a single startup gets funding without some sort of battle of wills. For decades, these conversations have been not only behind closed doors but also confidential. Negotiations are rarely made public, which casts a shadow of mystery over the entire process. We're bringing you into the negotiation room with a Live Term Sheet Negotiation. NYU Tandon Future Labs teams up with Morrison & Foerster (MoFo), a leading startup & venture law firm, in a debate-style event to educate early-stage founders on the anatomy of a term sheet: Find out which terms are most important to each side of a negotiation, learn how to close an investment round despite competing interests, & see the stakes behind each clause.  Here's how this works: Each side (startup & investor) & their representative legal counsel (a MoFo Partner) reveal to the audience the critical points they are targeting in the negotiation. A debate-style format follows, moderated by Pete Fusco, co-chair of the VC practice at Morrison Foerster. The audience asks MoFo lawyers, the founder, & the investor any questions that might have popped up during the negotiation.  Playing the founder role in the negotiation will be Steve Kuyan, co-founder & CEO of Luro Health, a startup combatting obesity for Medicare & Medicaid patients at Community Health Centers. Prior to Luro Health, Steve co-founded, Culina Health, a leading clinical nutrition care delivery company; the NYU Tandon Future Labs, a NYC/NYU-Tandon based incubator; the NYU Center for Responsible AI, an academic research center building a future in which responsible AI is synonymous with AI; & was the first Director of Entrepreneurship at NYU Tandon launching programs like the AX Venture Studio, InnoVention, & a minor in Engineering Innovation.  Steve will be represented by Jae Zhou, a startup & venture capital partner at MoFo & based in New York City. Playing the role of investor will be Craig Wilson, a Venture Partner at Collaborative Fund, a NYC-based fund backing entrepreneurs pushing the world forward. For 10 years, He was the Executive Director of Innovation & Entrepreneurship at the NYU Tandon School of Engineering & a Managing Director at the NYU Tandon Future Labs.  Craig was the founding CEO of the Climate Collective. He also co-founded a company called The Crop Project - a regenerative agricultural processing company focused on kelp. Craig will be represented by Frank Paz, a startup & venture capital partner at MoFo & based in New York City. Looking forward to seeing you there!

events.name: From Failure To Founder - Building Human-First AI Startups
events.description: Learn how Julio Alvarez - TEDx speaker & creator of "Braving Big Tech" - is leading with humanity in an AI world. Discover why he thinks leadership needs less perfection & more truth, & see how failure can be turned into fuel for founders who are building technology as authentic leaders. Julio Alvarez has seen the inside of Silicon Valley's biggest names, from Apple to Google. He's launched products used by millions, & he's also been fired four times.  Four. Times.  Those experiences -- the highs & the lows -- have shaped his perspective on what it takes to lead. Especially now in this uncertain environment. Many founders building in AI focus on the technical side -- the code & the algorithms. But what about the human side? What happens when you face setbacks, when the path isn't clear?  Julio's story shows that failure isn't the end. Failure can be a starting point. On March 25th, explore with Julio how to build AI startups that prioritize people, both within your team & in your product. You'll learn how to navigate challenges, build resilience, & lead with authenticity in a rapidly changing tech landscape.  Discover how to turn your own experiences -- even the difficult ones -- into a foundation for innovation & lasting impact. Tickets for this event include food & drinks, as well as exclusive access to this transformative entrepreneur who will show you how to: Transform setbacks into strategic advantages. Build AI startups that prioritize human connection. Lead with authenticity in a rapidly evolving tech landscape. Develop resilience for navigating the challenges of entrepreneurship. Incorporate emotional intelligence into your leadership style. You'll also meet dozens of other high-performing entrepreneurs who are creating their next big thing. Seriously, it's some of the best founder networking in the city. Getting a ticket guarantees admission. No waitlisting. We're meeting LIVE AND IN-PERSON at The Yard, a coworking space at the intersection of innovation, creativity, design, & play -- with locations in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Philly, & DC -- with a variety of shared & private workspace options. Learn how Julio Alvarez - TEDx speaker & creator of "Braving Big Tech" - is leading with humanity in an AI world. Discover why he thinks leadership needs less perfection & more truth, & see how failure can be turned into fuel for founders who are building technology as authentic leaders. Julio Alvarez has seen the inside of Silicon Valley's biggest names, from Apple to Google. He's launched products used by millions, & he's also been fired four times.  Four. Times.  Those experiences -- the highs & the lows -- have shaped his perspective on what it takes to lead. Especially now in this uncertain environment. Many founders building in AI focus on the technical side -- the code & the algorithms. But what about the human side? What happens when you face setbacks, when the path isn't clear?  Julio's story shows that failure isn't the end. Failure can be a starting point. On March 25th, explore with Julio how to build AI startups that prioritize people, both within your team & in your product. You'll learn how to navigate challenges, build resilience, & lead with authenticity in a rapidly changing tech landscape.  Discover how to turn your own experiences -- even the difficult ones -- into a foundation for innovation & lasting impact. Tickets for this event include food & drinks, as well as exclusive access to this transformative entrepreneur who will show you how to: Transform setbacks into strategic advantages. Build AI startups that prioritize human connection. Lead with authenticity in a rapidly evolving tech landscape. Develop resilience for navigating the challenges of entrepreneurship. Incorporate emotional intelligence into your leadership style. You'll also meet dozens of other high-performing entrepreneurs who are creating their next big thing. Seriously, it's some of the best founder networking in the city. Getting a ticket guarantees admission. events.description: Watch a live taping of The Feedback Loop on Tuesday, March 25th! Every week, we invite a batch of early-stage startup founders to sharpen their pitch - in front of a live audience & later released on YouTube. There are no slides, there is no script, & there is no live funding happening - it's all about the natural pitch. Because the thing that holds most founders back? Storytelling. It always comes back to storytelling. Doors open at 6pm ET, & the show will begin at 6:30pm.

Our Supermomos Curated Dinner is more than just a night out - we are launching an exclusive invitation to join our Super Diners Club, a members-only experience that connects curious & open-minded people like you for dinners twice a month, right here in NYC! Personalized curation process: To make the experience uniquely yours, you will only be accepted into the program if we believe we have the right kinds of members who are a good fit for your dining table! Additionally, we might group you into different houses as well before the dinner  Surprise venue: Each dinner is hosted at a surprise restaurant that you'll discover just 1-3 days before the event If you're ready to turn these monthly dinners into a long-term experience with new friends & unexpected connections, this club was made for you.

events.name: Computational Techniques For Making Karaoke Harder
events.description: Computational Techniques For Making Karaoke HarderThe world is hurtling toward a crisis: karaoke is getting too easy. Safety researchers now project that by the year 2030, everyone will be bored of every song & the karaoke industry will collapse, setting off a domino effect that destroys civilization in an event known as the Karaokalypse. Hosted by Numeric, your AI-assistant across the entire accounting lifecycle, Jamie Brew (The Onion, ClickHole, Botnik, RC W2 2019) will present humanity's last hope: The Weird Algorithm, a state-of-the-art system for making karaoke harder by changing the words but keeping the melody. Given an input song, it replaces the lyrics with fragments of text from specific datasets (e.g. Craigslist ads for old cars, Yelp reviews of psychics & the script of Mean Girls) to create a new song that has never been sung before & will never be sung again. Through a series of demos & deep dives, we'll cover a range of karaoke hardening techniques from the fields of natural language processing (NLP), artificial "intelligence" (A"I") & showbiz. We'll look at how to collect, annotate & model data for procedural use, & at how the software project has grown in tandem with the live show. We'll consider some alternative metaphors for text generation besides "the machine is a person" & address the urgent question of whether it's ethical to work on anything other than avant-garde karaoke research. Singing along will be optional, encouraged, & nearly impossible. Numeric is the AI-powered close management platform. Organize your close, streamline reconciliations, & leverage AI for auto-drafted flux analysis + reporting. Spend less time on the manual, & more time on the impactful.

events.name: AI Talks - Fine Tuning Gen AI & ML & LLMs
events.description: AI technology like OpenAI's ChatGPT, Google's Gemini, Anthropic's Claude, Midjourney & many others will play an increasingly large role in our day-to-day lives. To this end, New York AI Users will host our monthly tech talks & social gathering at Viam's office in Midtown. Viam is an engineering platform for data, AI, and. automation. They will graciously provide free drinks & food for the event. The space & accommodations will be perfect for our talks & the social that follows. From the creators & organizers of New York Tech & Beer, New York AI Users organizes high-quality AI events that both educate & connect AI enthusiasts in the New York area who use or want to use AI to meet their creative, entrepreneurial, & technical aspirations. No technical background is required, only an interest in learning about these tools of the future. Founders, engineers, & creatives are all welcome! For our March meeting, we will gather at Viam & we will host: Talks on AI:For our first talk, we will hear from Sudheer Gaddipati, who will discuss how Machine Learning & LLMs complement each other. Have you ever wondered whether to use ML or LLM for your use case? This talk unpacks how they're built, how they are trained, & where they fit best. We will touch on architectures, real-world uses, & how these things work together. Sudheer will describe how models like DeepSeek & GPT/Grok3 leverage ML & LLMs to power their capabilities. Sudheer has over 25 years of experience in software engineering, with a background in Computer Science Engineering & a Post Graduate Program in AI & Machine Learning. His work spans the entire Software Engineering Lifecycle (SEL) & DevOps, driving large-scale enterprise technology initiatives, system optimizations, & automation efforts. With a strong foundation in software engineering & AI, he focuses on seamlessly integrating AI into existing systems, ensuring it delivers practical value while complementing human expertise.For our second talk, we will hear from Xavier Huang about how to effectively increase the accuracy of Gen AI's response by fine tuning the model. Xavier will touch on the different factors we need to consider when we fine tune an LLM. The talk will center around how users can improve the accuracy of these models over time. Xavier is the founder of Manditutors.com & theaitutors.com, has been programming for over 10 years, & specializes in AL & ML. He is passionate about innovating education with technology.After the talks, there will be social time with the attendees & the speakers for the remainder of the evening, with free drinks & foodWe're excited to see you soon! Note: There will be no refunds for cancellations within 48 hours of the event

events.name: All In - Founder & Investor Poker Night
events.description: Join us for an evening of networking, & friendly competition at All In: Founder & Investor Poker Night. Connect with fellow founders & investors over a night of friendly competition, great conversation, & plenty of poker-alongside food & drinks. This event is co-hosted by Lerer Hippeau, one of NYC's most notable VC funds. Maurice Russo, an investor at Lerer Hippeau & a former professional poker player, will be representing their team at the tables. Note: This is a no-cash game-just good fun, great company, & prizes on the line! Lynx CollectiveLynx Collective empowers & advances the NYC startup ecosystem. We foster connections through our programming & events & share insights via our weekly newsletter. Lynx Collective was founded by two 20-year veterans of the NYC startup ecosystem: Andrew Chang (investor, advisor, board member) & Dorothy Chang (investor at NextWave NYC & Flybridge). About our Sponsor (Goodwin & Rho) Goodwin is in the business of building authentic, long-term relationships with our clients, who are some of the world's most successful & innovative investors, entrepreneurs & disruptors in the life sciences, private equity, real estate, technology & financial industries, & where they converge. Goodwin's immersive understanding of these industries - combined with expertise across high-stakes litigation & dispute resolution, world-class regulatory compliance & advisory services, & complex transactions - sets them apart. From two-person startups to public companies, Rho is the banking platform with everything businesses need to manage cash, control spend, & automate finance busywork. Rho offers corporate cards, banking, treasury, expense management, AP, accounting automation, & more in one integrated platform backed by award-winning support. Rho is a fintech company, not a bank. Checking & card services provided by Webster Bank, N.A., member FDIC; savings account services provided by American Deposit Management, & its partner banks.

Rho offers corporate cards, banking, treasury, expense management, AP, accounting automation, & more in one integrated platform backed by award-winning support. Rho is a fintech company, not a bank. Checking & card services provided by Webster Bank, N.A., member FDIC; savings account services provided by American Deposit Management, & its partner banks.

events.name: Ugly Talk - Consumer Packaged Goods Businesses
events.description: Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) founders know the journey can be tough-from ever-rising production costs to finding loyal customers in a crowded market. This Ugly Talk event dives straight into the gritty realities of building, distributing, & scaling products people love. Expect candid confessions of epic wins, near-misses, & everything in between, all wrapped into an evening of practical insights & genuine connections. Who Should Be in the Room? CPG Founders looking to launch, refine, or grow their product lines. Early-Stage Entrepreneurs aiming to avoid costly production & branding pitfalls. Industry Experts & Mentors wanting to share expertise & support growing brands. Professional Services & Suppliers ready to collaborate with emerging CPG ventures.    What You'll Walk Away With Practical Lessons for Overcoming Challenges Hear how experienced founders tackled manufacturing mishaps, supply chain hurdles, & brand-building headaches. Learn how each failure became a stepping stone to better, smarter business decisions. Resilience, Innovation, & Identity Discover how creative branding, customer feedback loops, & continuous product improvement keep CPG brands fresh & authentic. Explore how to stay true to your core identity even while you expand to new categories or markets. Connections & Resources Meet fellow founders, mentors, & industry supporters who've been there & done that. Walk away with real contacts, proven strategies, & resource networks that you can tap into for every stage of your CPG journey.    Discussion Topics Manufacturing & Supply Chain Realities Candid stories on production costs, lead times, & quality control. Find out what it really takes to partner with suppliers & co-packers who can help you scale. Branding, Marketing, & Distribution From packaging design to retail shelves & e-commerce strategies-uncover methods for standing out in a saturated market. Scaling & Funding Explore how founders fund growth, whether through bootstrapping, crowdfunding, or VC investments. Learn tips for scaling up without losing your brand's soul. Customer Feedback & Product Iteration See how listening closely to customers spurs innovation & brand loyalty. Learn how to refine your offerings using data & real-world insights.   Why You Can't Afford to Miss This Gain Hard-Earned Wisdom: Learn from panelists who turned mistakes into triumphs, & discover how to refine your own approach. Network with Like-Minded Founders: Connect with fellow CPG entrepreneurs facing similar challenges-and unlock potential collaborations. Meet Future Partners & Investors: Build relationships with the folks who can provide the capital, expertise, or distribution channels to scale your brand.    Panel Lineup April Wachtel - Founder & CEO of Cheeky Cocktails April Wachtel has spent over two decades in the beverage & hospitality industry. She is an experienced mixologist, a cocktail & spirits instructor, the Founder & CEO of Cheeky, & the Host of the Movers & Shakers podcast. In her spare time she coaches early-stage CPG founders with a focus on idea phase to $500K+ in revenue.   JW Wiseman - Founder of Curious Elixirs JW Wiseman, founder of Curious Elixirs, pioneered the booze-free movement a decade ago, crafting bold, non-alcoholic cocktails before sober curious became a term. Under his leadership, Curious Elixirs has become a category leader, promoting mindful consumption through initiatives like The Great Curious Cocktail Party & the upcoming Stay Curious podcast. Committed to redefining social drinking, Wiseman inspires a global community to embrace joy, flavor, & connection without compromise.     Nicole Light  - Founder of Power in Packaging Award-winning designer combines product development, package design & manufacturing services, helping entrepreneurs & enterprise companies bring innovative products & ideas to the market with powerful & cost-effective branding & packaging.   Moderated by Glenn Johnson - Marketing Consultant at Fractional CMO Glenn Johnson works with small brands, startups, & founders to address their marketing needs. Formerly a VP/Creative Director at a Madison Avenue marketing & branding agency specializing in luxury & bespoke audiences, he brings expertise across multiple verticals. As a category-agnostic brand storyteller, he helps founders define their vision & develop their brand.   Supported by    PRIVATE OFFICES AND SHARED WORKSPACES FOR INDIVIDUALS AND TEAMS For a limited time, enjoy 20% off at The Yard Coworking Space. Use code GREYJ24 or mention Grey Journal when scheduling your tour.

events.name: Rust Meetup
events.description: We have a NEW LOCATION & DIFFERENT DAY OF WEEK for this event!  For our fourth meetup of 2025, we're extremely excited to a talk by Michael Gattozzi (Influx Data) entitled I can't believe that's legal Rust! Lesser known tips & tricks for writing & organizing your Rust code. Michael is a prolific speaker & has spoken at RustConf 2024 about What happens when you run `cargo build`?, at RustConf 2022 about Weird expressions & where to find them, at RustLatam 2019 about Defense Against The Wrong Logic: Proactive Rust Coding, & at RustConf 2017 about Shipping a solid Rust crate. He is currently a senior software engineer at InfluxDB. He can be found on Twitter as @mgattozzi & on BlueSky as [@mgattozzi.dev](https://bsky.app/profile/mgattozzi.dev). Come on down to a new location: "The studio" (10th floor) at 7WTC at 250 Greenwich Street & on a different day of week: Wednesday! Doors open at 6:30pm to give people plenty of time to grab pizza & socialize, & then the talk starts at 7:30! It should be a good time! Hope to see you there! We're extremely excited to announce that Lawrence Harvey is Rust NYC's official recruitment partner sponsor! The space was generously sponsored by Eulith, which provides asset managers & accredited investors with insured, cutting-edge technology & financial services to access & manage capital on-chain & is a heavy user of Rust!

events.name: HackerRank Programming Competition
events.description: Join us for the HackerRank Programming Competition & put your problem-solving to the test! Whether you're just starting out or have plenty of experience, this is your chance to challenge yourself, sharpen your skills, & see how you stack up. This in-person event will take place on Wednesday, March 26th, 2025, from 7-9 PM in City College's Marshak Science Building in room MR043. Whether you're just starting out or have plenty of experience, this is your chance to challenge yourself, sharpen your skills, & see how you stack up. All skill levels are welcome-jump in & start coding!   This event is open to the public! However, please bring your state ID or CUNY ID for access to the building. Check-in will be at 7 PM by Room MR1   We're proud to announce the soft launch of our new office at CCNY which was made possible by Gaming Pathways. This means a dedicated space for gaming, community, & a home for the Collective. As a part of our effort to develop this hub, we're hosting weekly events in the evenings on Wednesdays at CCNY (Midweek Mashup), where the space is open to the public! Esports, Casual Gaming, & Game Development events are run simultaneously during our Midweek Mashups.   Join EGD Collective's Discord server for announcements relating to the workshop & future Wednesday events   ------ The EGD Collective is a grassroots movement across North America with a mission to help every student finish their education & find their place within gaming.   We are a one-of-a-kind leadership development experience that not only prevents students from dropping out or getting academically dismissed but prepares & propels students into STEM & arts careers within the games industry.   Learn more about us at https://egdcollective.org   Follow us on socials! Instagram @egdcollective X/Twitter @egdcollective LinkedIn @EGD Collective Frequently asked questionsDo I need to be a current student to attend?No! Our weekly Wednesday events are open to the public, we welcome & encourage all industry professionals & game enthusiasts to come along! We require all attendees to enter the building prepared with their ID in order for them to gain access to the building.

events.name: TOFU Challenge - B2B Marketing Hackathon For Good

events.name: Lega Creatorcon
events.description: In an era of unprecedented AI-driven transformation within the legal industry, there's never been a more important time to marshal community & share learning with peers. CreatorCon is where legal's AI pioneers will come together to share learning, build community, & reimagine what's possible in legal's AI-enabled future. From inspiring discussions with boundary-pushing innovators to guided, hands-on workshops that build progressively from simple prompts to complex applications, every aspect of CreatorCon is designed to deepen your practical expertise. Through expert lightning talks on critical topics like model selection & prompt engineering, paired with collaborative small-group exercises, you'll experience the full journey of LLM application development in a supportive environment that sparks meaningful connections & inspires fresh ideas. Thanks to our partnership with SKILLS.LAW-whose peerless network is at the forefront of legal innovation-CreatorCon promises a uniquely powerful forum for reimagining what's possible in legal's AI-enabled future. #creatorcon2025 For more information, please visit: https://lega.ai/creatorcon

events.name: Future-Proof Your Career In Age Of AI - Build Your AI Roadmap
events.description: The School of Information at Pratt Institute is pleased to invite you to the talk, Future-Proof Your Career in the Age of AI: Building Your AI Roadmap with Dr. Joan Palmiter Bajorek.   About the Talk If you are worried about the job market & how to be resilient in the age of AI, this event is for you. Harvard Business Review research estimates that 50% of US adults are experiencing layoff anxiety. If you feel this anxiety, you're not alone. Despite a PhD & enterprise work in AI & tech for over a decade, Dr. Joan Palmiter Bajorek has been let go in 2 large-scale AI layoffs. She's been resilient in her career via personal branding, networking, & financial acumen. She has closed 6- & 7-figure contracts, has 22 income streams, hosts an international podcast, & published a book with Wiley. In her new Amazon bestselling book, Your AI Roadmap: Expand Your Career, Money, & Joy, Dr. Bajorek shares concrete actions to future-proof your career in the age of AI with clinically validated & data-driven frameworks. With humor, warmth, & personal stories, attendees will depart with action steps to build resilience & confidence in their careers & journyes as they craft their own roadmap through the age of AI.   About the Speaker Dr. Joan Palmiter Bajorek is an entrepreneur, investor, bestselling author, & AI influencer, ranked the #4 influencer in Voice AI. As CEO of Clarity AI, she builds custom AI solutions & hosts the "Your AI Roadmap" podcast with top AI experts. Featured in Forbes, her book with Wiley, Your AI Roadmap: Expand Your Career, Money, & Joy, explores resilience via personal branding, networking, & financial freedom in the age of AI. Dr. Bajorek founded Women in Voice, a nonprofit with 65k+ followers. With 10+ years in AI builds, she's held senior positions at startups & Fortune 500. She holds a PhD in Conversational AI & is based in Seattle.

Our core goal is to connect people through IRL networking events, online networking events & large summits.   Enjoy NYC's most successful Startup & Tech Mixer. events.name: Break The Ice x Biotech
events.description: Join us at Break The Ice x BIOTECH:We know networking events can sometimes feel a little awkward without the right icebreaker - so we're here to help. Whether you're making new connections or rekindling old ones, this evening is the perfect opportunity to break the ice an event inspired by warmer weather & optimism. The vibe is all about connecting great people & having a good time. As the energy of spring inspires growth & renewal, we're excited to foster connections among biotech founders, venture capitalists, academic leaders, & industry innovators. Join us to share ideas, build relationships, & celebrate the season of possibilities. Note this is a 'feel-good' evening & you must RSVP to secure your spot-doors open at 6 PM. Here's what you can look forward to: The Sweet Sixteen Tip-off for all our basketball lovers An interactive mixer designed to spark authentic & meaningful conversations An epic grazing table to delight your taste buds Hard & Soft Bar featuring craft cocktails, beer, wine, & non-alcoholic options Special Thank You To Our Sponsors: Safety Partners Safety Partners is a portal into a rich array of EHS experience & expertise, giving you a wealth of knowledge at your fingertips. events.name: Rise Of Growth Engg
events.description: Join South Park Commons & a group of New York City's leading tech companies for a deep dive into growth engineering.nDemos will be followed by Q&A & networking. If you're interested in pushing boundaries in software, you don't want to miss this one.nWe'll have lightning demos from Profound, Modal, & Hebbiajoin for a glimpse into how they're using growth engineering to acquire users.nAkshat Bubna is the co-founder & CTO of Modal. Prior to Modal, Akshat was a Staff Software Engineer at Scale AI. Customers use Modal as a cloud platform to deploy fine-tuning, ML inference, data jobs, & more at scale.nAdithya (Addy) started as one Hebbia'searliest engineering hires & now runs the applied AI function. His team is focused on building information retrieval systems, document understanding capabilities & copiloting experiences.Hebbia revolutionizes document analysis for knowledge workers, providing insights across complex docs to accelerate decision-making. By leveraging AI, Hebbia streamlines diligence & research processes, empowering professionals to unlock value from vast amounts of data efficiently.nDylan Babbs is the co-founder & CTO of Profound. Previously, Dylan built product & maps experiences at Uber & is a graduate of University of Washington. Hundreds of millions of consumers are using AI Search Engines like ChatGPT & Perplexity to discover products & brands. Profound helps brands understand & control how they appear in AI Answers. Built by an ex-Uber team in NYC, Profound is already working with multiple F500 brands & global agencies.nAbout South Park Commons:    SPC isa home for the most talented technologists figuring out what's nexta community designed to turn the chaos of possibility into the clarity of conviction. Whether you're exploring startup ideas, refining your thinking on a new product, or looking to dive into a new domain, we're here to help you get from -1 to 0.nRegistration & approval is required & space is limited, so please RSVP soon.

events.name: Mastering Business Growth Lifecycle
events.description: Workshop 2: Set Your Business Up for Scalable Success! (In-person)  Thursday, March 27 | 6-8 PM ET | Civic Hall Union Square, 124 E 14th Street In this session, we'll recap Workshop #1 & discuss feedback on "Corporatising Your Business". We then introduce the final two elements of the Business Growth Lifecycle: Process Management & Storytelling.  You'll receive an overview of FD Global Academy's "Roadmap for Growth" framework to apply to your business including exclusive access to our Global Scalability Audit. Trena Blair, CEO, FD Global Connections Ms. Trena Blair, an internationally awarded & highly accomplished global businesswoman, is the CEO of FD Global Connections, a specialist global growth company she founded in 2014. With ease, she traverses transcontinental corporate & entrepreneurial communities. In 2024, Ms. Blair published her first book, Decoding Global Growth: How Successful Companies Scale Internationally, which achieved #1 Amazon Best Seller (Australia), #1 Amazon Best New Release (USA) & Book of the Year Stevie International Business Women's Awards. Subsequently, her book has been converted into FD Global Academy, an online e-learning platform to empower entrepreneurs globally with the knowledge, frameworks, templates & connections to successfully expand. A global citizen & qualified company Director, Ms. Blair has lived & worked in both Australia & the United States & combines her CEO responsibilities with a Board portfolio.

All refunds will be issued to the original method of payment. Cancellations (early bird, standard, special group registrations) received in writing less than 7 days before the event date will not be eligible for a refund. Substitutions (i.e. ticket transfers) are allowed by individuals within the same organization, before the event or onsite. Badge swapping/sharing is strictly prohibited. Refunds are not eligible for registrants who do not attend the event (no show) & do not provide a written cancellation in advance of the event date. If an event is canceled or postponed, refunds will offered for the entire purchase

events.name: Prove It - Early Pilots To Demonstrate Clinical & Operational Outcomes
events.description: One of the bits of secret sauce for the strong venture outcomes in my day job leading the NYU Healthtech Venture Studio is that I push my teams hard to do clinical pilots as soon as the tech is useable & safe. In addition to the obvious goal of proving that your widget "does what it says on the tin," I've found that (particularly in digital health) implementing early clinical pilots create a forcing function for new teams to align with & course correct for the actual needs of institutional stakeholders, patients, & families that they will need to work with if their widget is to ever succeed. David Putrino PhD, Director of Rehab Innovation for Mt. Sinai Health System regularly designs & implements early pilots with medical devices, brain computer interfaces, & digital health interventions originating internally at Mt Sinai & from outside companies. He is also a key stakeholder brought in to help determine whether the health system will pivot with startups. The format for the workshop will be as always 45 minute lecture by David as to what matters when designing & executing early pilots. (snack break) A fireside chat with stakeholders who often get pitched by startups & have to make sense of alleged validation. Evan Huang was the cofounder of Caresignal, which he eventually exited. In that role, he established a 5k patient umbrella IRB under which they ran clinical studies on all of their programs & published many towards establishing both ROI & clinical efficacy for new customers. Samrat Kulkarni previously Lead Director of Clinical Analytics at CVS. Samrat owned causal inference & outcomes measurement for various clinical care management programs across Aetna & Caremark LOBs. Experience developing relevant clinical, financial & operational metrics to study pilot effectiveness & inform strategic investments. Led team of data scientists, biostatisticians & health economists.

events.name: Columbia Sustainability Symposium
events.description: The 2025 Columbia Sustainability Symposium will convene industry leaders & academics to examine the technologies, financial mechanisms, & operational strategies that improve resource efficiency across global industries.nThe morning sessions will focus on the enabling industries that provide the infrastructure, technology, & resources across sectors at scale. Discussions will cover the latest advancements in clean energy deployment, financing for sustainable technologies, & circular manufacturing.nThe afternoon will feature industry-specific discussions on how fashion, electronics, & food companies are adapting their supply chains, materials, & production processes to reduce waste & environmental impact while maintaining operational viability.nPlease note that this Luma page is for non-Columbia affiliates only.nSchedulenMorningn 8:00 - 8:45: Registration & Coffeen 8:45 - 9:30: Opening Remarks & Morning Keynote, Speakers:nAnn Tracy, CSO of Colgate-Palmolive;nDeborah Dull, Founder of The Circular Supply Chain Network, Managing Partner at Trillium Digital Services.n 9:30 - 10:20: Session 1: Charting Decarbonization Pathways for the U.S. Electric Power Sector, Speakers:nTravis Bradford, President & Founder of the Prometheus Institute for Sustainable Development - Columbia University Professor & Senior Lecturer;nHafiz Bello, Deputy Director of Innovation (Grid Modernization at NYSERDA;nScott Schwartz, VP of Development at RWE.nBenjamin Hertz-Shagel, Global Head of Grid Edge at Wood Mackenzie.n 10:20 - 10:50: Coffee Breakn 10:50 - 11:40: Session 2: Financing Enabling Technologies Across the U.S. & Emerging Markets, Speakers:nCarolyn Kim Allwin, Adjunct Professor, previous Head of ESG & Sustainability at Capco;nLauren Singer, Managing Partner at Overview;nEmilio Fabbrizzi, Managing Director, Americas Head of Renewable & Infrastructure at DNB Markets;nChris Creed, Partner at Galvanize Climate Solutions.n 11:40 - 12:30: Session 3: Circular Material & Product Flows, Speakers:nAly Bryan, Investor at Closed Loop Partners;nTom Szaky, CEO at TerraCycle;nDeborah Dull, Founder of The Supply Chain Network, Managing Partner at Trillium Digital Services;nLauren Phipps, Chief of Staff at Molg.nAfternoonn 12:30 - 2:00: Lunch Breakn 2:00 - 2:50: Session 4: Fashion - Fighting the Rise of Trash Fashion, Speakers:nMichelle Gabriel, Program Director at IE New York College - Adjunct Faculty at Columbia;nKim Matsoukas, Director of Sustainability at Coach;nRachel Van Metre Kibbe, CEO at Circular Services Group - CEO at American Circular Textiles - Strategic Advisor at The Nature Conservancy;nJess Schreiber, Founder & CEO at FABSCRAP.n3:00 - 3:50: Session 5: Electronics - Sustainable Hardware Product Life Cycles, Speakers:nKenny Arnold, Senior Manager of Service Design at Ellen MacArthur Foundation;nDavid Hirschler, Chief Sustainability Officer at ERI;nRich Bulger, Partner at Capital Growth Partners;nLucas Gutterman, Designed to Last Campaign Director at PIRG.n 4:00 - 4:50: Session 6: Food - Supply Chain Innovation & Sustainable Sourcing, Speakers:nJohn Lee, Director, Mission & Sustainability, Nature at Danone;nMegan Larmer, Senior Director or Programs at Glynwood Center for Regional Food & Farming;nSarela Herrada, Co-Founder at SIMPLi - Board Member at Regenerative Organic Alliance;nEthan Soloviev, Chief Innovation Officer at HowGood.n 5:00 - 7:00: Networking, Appetizers + CocktailsnThe night prior to the Symposium, March 27th, we will be co-hosting a Critical Minerals Circular Supply Chain Hackathon. Winners will be eligible to present their solutions during the Symposium.

events.name: Transit Techies
events.description: The Center for Urban Science + Progress (CUSP) at NYU Tandon & Transit Techies welcome you to attend a talk by Bianca Ng on "The Museum of Transversal Art," a sophisticated data visualization created using Tableau that offers both analytical insights & visual narratives about the spatial distribution of art installations throughout the transit system. This project combines exploratory & explanatory elements, inviting users to engage with the data before experiencing the artwork in person-mirroring Ng's own methodology of data validation through site visits. Created for the 2024 MTA Open Data Challenge, the visualization demonstrates an innovative use of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority's datasets. Specifically, Ng merged the Permanent Art Catalog with the MTA Subway Stations dataset to create a comprehensive mapping of public art installations. In recognition of its excellence, "The Museum of Transversal Art" was distinguished as a finalist for providing the "most comprehensive view of the data" in November 2024. Additionally, the project received the prestigious "Viz of the Day" designation on Tableau Public. Join Transit Techies, CUSP, & Bianca Ng for an exploration of the remarkable artistic collection maintained within the MTA system! Additionally, connect with NYU CUSP & Transit Techies NYC at this talk & enjoy networking over light bites & refreshments. The event will be held at 370 Jay Street, Brooklyn, NY, 12th Floor, in Room 1201. We hope to see you there!  Visitor InformationPlease visit the NYU Tandon website for directions & a campus map. Advance registration through Eventbrite is required for campus access at NYU for external guests. Attendees who are not current students, faculty, or staff at NYU, including alumni, are asked to register using a personal email address.  About CUSP at NYU TandonThe Center for Urban Science + Progress (CUSP) at NYU Tandon is an interdisciplinary center dedicated to applying science, technology, engineering, math, & social sciences to serve urban communities worldwide. Founded as a partnership between NYU & the City of New York, CUSP leads research, educational, & entrepreneurial initiatives that advance the science of cities. By applying novel insights to urban issues, we develop data- & technology-driven approaches that drive positive impact. With an additional focus on training future leaders, CUSP offers interdisciplinary academic programs in applied urban science & informatics for graduate students & professionals. CUSP also engages with stakeholders across city agencies, start-ups, industry players, community-based organizations, & nonprofits to address urgent socioeconomic, environmental, & infrastructural challenges. The center's ultimate objective is to improve urban quality of life by using data to innovate & refine inclusive, equitable, & sustainable practices for cities everywhere. About Transit Techies NYCBringing together the technologists who love transit & the transit enthusiasts who hack! We'll have speakers present transit-related projects. Presenters may be household hackers, data scientists, researchers, product developers, or you! All presentations will be technical & awesome. Learn more about Transit Techies NYC & join the MeetUp Group.

events.name: Gen & Juice Drinks Night
events.description: Are you an AI Filmmaker? Do you work for a Gen AI Company? Join us for drinks! Join us for a relaxed night of drinks, connections, & conversation with fellow AI filmmakers & startup founders who share a passion for pushing the boundaries of creative technology.  This isn't one of our typical Gen Jams-think of it more like a casual get-together designed for meeting new collaborators, swapping insights on the latest tools, & simply having fun among like-minded peers. Whether you've just wrapped an AI-driven production, launched a startup, or are brainstorming your next big venture, you'll find plenty of new faces to connect with-and maybe even spark your next collaboration. So raise a glass & toast to the future of AI-powered cinema alongside the community that's shaping it!

Our conversations & workshops will feed your mind & inspire you to improve your neighborhood. To attend, you need to purchase tickets. Venue is accessible & content is all ages friendly! If you have accessibility questions or needs, please email us at < schoolofdata@beta.nyc >. If you can't join us in person, tune into the main stage live stream < schoolofdata.nyc/live > provided by the Internet Society New York Chapter & sponsored by Reinvent Albany. Follow the conversation #nycsodata on Bluesky.

events.name: Stories about Human Centered AI
events.description: About this eventEvent guidelines: All attendees are strongly encouraged to wear a face mask at all times.Tickets are limited to restrict capacity.Copies of the panelist's books will be available for purchase at the event.A signing will follow the panel.Home address is collected for contact tracing purposes; it will not be used otherwise.The event will not be livestreamed, but it will be recorded.As a reminder: If you are not feeling well, please do not come to the event, even if you have a ticket; email us & we'll work it out.If you have any questions regarding these guidelines or to request accessibility accommodations, please contact bsfwriters@gmail.com.   Hosted by Brooklyn Speculative Fiction Writers:Artificial Intelligence, a staple of speculative fiction, is here. Now we are playing catch up. We all have a gestalt conception, a feeling of what we don't want from A.I. But beyond that, we demand stories that better defines the right place for A.I. in our society, be it governance, economy, ecology, or the arts. We demand human centered A.I. Featuring: Hilary Mason is the co-founder & CEO of Hidden Door, a game technology studio creating a platform for fans of books, movies, & TV shows to play together in their favorite fictional worlds. Prior to Hidden Door, Hilary was General Manager of the Machine Learning business unit at Cloudera. She previously founded Fast Forward Labs, an applied machine learning research & consulting startup which Cloudera acquired in 2017. Additionally, she was Data Scientist in Residence at Accel Partners, co-founded HackNY, & was Chief Scientist at bitly. Hilary has received numerous awards, is a regular keynote speaker, & has advised startups, corporations, & governments Matthew Kressel is a multiple Nebula & World Fantasy Award nominated author & coder. His many works of short fiction have appeared in Analog, Asimov's, Lightspeed, Clarkesworld, Tor.com/Reactor, Beneath Ceaseless Skies, & many other publications & anthologies, including multiple Year's Bests. Eighteen of his stories are included in his debut collection, Histories Within Us, now out from Senses Five Press. His far-future novel Space Trucker Jess is coming in 2025 from Fairwood Press. And his Mars-based novella The Rainseekers is forthcoming from Tordotcom in early 2026. Alongside Ellen Datlow, he runs the Fantastic Fiction at KGB reading series in Manhattan. And he is the creator of the Moksha submissions system, used by many of the largest fiction publishers today. Holden Lee is an assistant professor at Johns Hopkins focusing on mathematical foundations of AI, as well as a speculative fiction writer working on a novel about a half-mermaid's search for belonging. He co-organized the 2024 Workshop on Creativity & Generative AI in Vancouver to foster dialogue between machine learning researchers & creative professionals. Moderated by Rob Cameron. Books will be available for sale from Greenlight Books. Admission is free, but please consider donating to BSFW or the Octavia Project, an organization that fosters spaces of imagination & exploration for Brooklyn teens.   Who are the Brooklyn Speculative Fiction Writers?We are a Fractured Atlas Sponsored critique group for writers of speculative fiction, dedicated to raising the work of our members to a publishable, professional level. Even though the group is based in Brooklyn, many of our writers come from the other boroughs of the greater New York City metropolitan area, New Jersey, & even Massachusetts.

events.name: Coffee & AI Vibe Coding
events.description: Ready to turn your ideas into code alongside fellow innovators? Join us for Coffee & Vibe Coding-a 3-hour hackathon-style gathering at Narra Collective where AI enthusiasts come together to create, collaborate, & push the boundaries of AI-powered development. Vibe coding lets you describe software ideas in plain English, & AI-powered by large language models (LLMs)-generates the code for you. This event is your chance to team up, experiment, & bring your boldest concepts to life in a fast-paced, creative environment. Whether you're building a new feature or prototyping a full app, you'll leave with fresh insights & connections. Event Structure 9:30-10:00 AM: Coffee & Networking Fuel up with coffee, meet like-minded creators, & spark potential collaborations.10:00-10:20 AM: Project Pitches Share your idea in a quick pitch-whether you're looking for teammates or just want to inspire others.10:20-12:30 PM: Vibe Coding Sprint Dive into a focused coding session with AI as your co-pilot. Build, tweak, & iterate on your projects solo or with a team.12:30-1:00 PM: Show & Tell Present your results, get feedback, & celebrate everyone's creations-no matter how big or small.What to Bring To make the most of the session, please bring: A laptop with Cursor Composer (or a similar AI-powered IDE) installed & ready to go.Venue Details Hosted at the inspiring Narra Collective, 333 Washington St, Floor 3, Jersey City, NJ-a space designed for creativity & collaboration. Good to Know Cost: Free to attend, but spots are limited-register now!Who's Welcome: This event is tailored for those either already familiar with vibe coding or wanting to learn it. We ask for you to set up & try Cursor Composer before the meetup to let you really focus on the coding part of the event.Don't miss this chance to code, connect, & create with a community of forward-thinking developers. Secure your spot today!

events.name: Commercializing Deep Tech
events.description: Join us on March 31st at the Brooklyn Navy Yard for a dynamic panel discussion on commercializing deep tech hardware as part of NYC Deep Tech Week.nFeatured speakers include:nDaniel Oberhaus, Founder of HAUS: The Deep Tech Agency, a strategic communications firm specializing in marketing & PR for deep-tech startups. Daniel is also a former WIRED staff writer & the author of two books on technology & science, bringing a unique perspective on how emerging technologies gain traction.nAyub Ansari, Principal at Anthesis (a Carlyle-owned strategic advisory firm), where he champions investments & growth strategies for climate-tech & sustainability solutions.nOther panelists will discuss how theyve launched innovative technologies, formed strategic partnerships, protected IP, & tackled the challenges of scaling hardware ventures.nWere also looking for two additional startup founders to join the panel. If interested, please contact the event organizer.nAttendees will gain practical insights on protecting IP, securing partnerships, & communicating complex value propositions to investors & customers. Whether youre an entrepreneur aiming to bring next-generation solutions to market or simply curious about the future of hardware innovation, this session offers actionable takeaways & valuable networking opportunities.nAbout your host Jordan Fourcher:nJordan Fourcher is the Founder & CEO of Cryo X Co, a startup bringing next-generation cooling technology to market. Cryo X Co specializes in Passive Daytime Radiative Cooling (PDRC) coatings, which can lower surface temperatures by up to 15 below ambient airwithout power or waterby leveraging space as a heat sink.nCryo X is leading the commercialization & further development of these coatings, making them accessible for transportation, construction, & IoT applications.

She was recognized on 2024's Forbes 30 Under 30 list as an honoree in Venture Capital.  This event is part of our Female Founders & Funders series where we feature female founders & VCs as speakers. From theoretical physics, frontier biology, & ancient spiritual philosophy thinkers across thousands of years have struggled with the nature of mind & its interactions with reality.nCome & join for presentations from leaders in the field to understand the science of philosophy of the rich world within.nSpeakers:nStuart Hameroff, anasthesiologist & professor at the University of Arizona & one of the originators of the Penrose-Hameroff theory of Orchestrated Objective ReductionismnJoscha Bach, cognitive scientist, AI researcher & philosopher widely known for his work on artificial intelligence & philosophy of the mind.n(Special Guest To be Announced)

events.name: Microsoft MVP Feature Series
events.description: Join Microsoft Reactor & the Microsoft MVP Award program for a new monthly tech talk series. Each installment of the MVP Feature Series, located at 11 Times Square, will feature two talks by MVPs & an hour of networking with the developer community! Session Title: Why M365 product development is different from project development Presenter: Peter Ward While products are designed to meet customers' needs & desires, projects are established to achieve specific goals or objectives. This difference is not widely understood by enterprise or Microsoft partner development teams. This session explains: Why agile is widely used in product development environments & less widely used in project development environments.When it makes sense to build a product for the Microsoft store.What development teams need to understand when developing a product?-How to define the development scope?How to make a product a commercial success?At the end of the session, attendees will understand that there is a big difference between the business model & decision process in a product versus project development environment.

events.name: Startup Pitch - The Feedback Loop
events.description: Watch a live taping of The Feedback Loop on Tuesday, April 1st! Every week, we invite a batch of early-stage startup founders to sharpen their pitch - in front of a live audience & later released on YouTube. After they deliver their 1 minute pitch, they'll receive 5 minutes of direct, actionable feedback on their pitch & concept from our check-writing investor judges. As always, hosted by Sherveen Mashayekhi, Founder & CEO of Free Agency & a guest venture capital judge. Want to pitch? Apply here: afterfeedback.com/applyImportant: this is an in-person event & will be recorded - but startups are all about execution, so don't be afraid of getting your idea out into the world! The session is unscripted & unfolds in real time - the judges don't know the founders' ideas upon their arrival. There are no slides, there is no script, & there is no live funding happening - it's all about the natural pitch. Because the thing that holds most founders back? Storytelling. It always comes back to storytelling. Doors open at 6pm ET, & the show will begin at 6:30pm.

events.name: DeSciNYC - How To Create Superbabies
events.description: This talk will explore how we can use polygenic scores to select embryos in order to reduce disease risks & influence mental & physical traits. It will also address some of the moral & policy questions this technology raises, as well as how it might evolve & change the trajectory of human civilization. Jonathan Anomaly was a professor at Duke & Penn for over a decade & now works with a stealth startup offering polygenic embryo screening. events.name: Impact-First Product Teams
events.description: IMPACT-FIRST PRODUCT TEAMS: MATT LEMAY IN CONVERSATION WITH ADAM THOMASIn an uncertain & volatile business world, it is more important than ever for product teams to demonstrate the value of their work. Join product consultant & author Matt LeMay to celebrate the release of his new book IMPACT-FIRST PRODUCT TEAMS, a real-world guide to defining success & focusing on the work that matters most. Matt has spent the last 15 years working with companies ranging from early-stage startups to Fortune 500 enterprises & tech companies like Google, Spotify, & Mailchimp. He'll be sharing lessons & examples from his work in a far-reaching & lively conversation with product consultant & Survival Metrics creator Adam Thomas. He'll also be giving away copies of his new book, & wondering why he moved to London when only New York truly understands the true majesty of a proper bacon egg & cheese sandwich. Thank you to the generous sponsor of this event, [Bubble.io](https://bubble.io/). Bubble is an AI visual development platform that enables anyone from first-time entrepreneurs to enterprise-level companies to take an idea from prompt to fully functional, scalable reality - all without writing or managing a single line of code. They are hiring Product People!

events.name: Smart City Expo
events.description: WE ARE THE COUNTRY'S LEADING EVENT FOR BUILDING SMART, SUSTAINABLE, AND GLOBALLY COMPETITIVE CITIES Smart City Expo USA is the U.S. edition of the world's biggest & most influential event on urban innovation, Smart City Expo World Congress (#SCEWC) by Fira Barcelona. The next decade of global competitiveness will be driven by future-ready, decarbonized cities investing in next-gen infrastructure. These cities will need to sustainably support AI & data centers, safe & stable digital connectivity, frontier research & innovation (space, quantum, semiconductor, biotech, cybersecurity), climate resilience, a healthy, skilled, mobile, & inclusive workforce, & a strong startup & entrepreneurial ecosystem.The time to build smart cities across the U.S. is NOW. With millions of fans preparing to visit North America to witness history at the Olympic games, FIFA matches, F1 races & more, join top government officials & leading global companies ensuring U.S. cities are modern, safe, sustainable, & future-ready. TOP SPEAKERS ANNOUNCED!Meet some of the global leaders preparing U.S. cities for F1 races, FIFA World Cup matches, & a smart, sustainable, & prosperous future.

events.name: OODA & Future Battlespace - Deep Tech, Cybersecurity & Nat'l Security In 21st Century
events.description: From AI-powered cyber warfare to quantum-secured communications & autonomous battle networks, deep tech is rewriting the rules of national security. As emerging technologies accelerate at an unprecedented pace, how should policymakers, defense leaders, & the great builders in the private sector adapt to ensure strategic advantage?nJoin OODA at New York Deep Tech Week for an elite event featuring national security veterans, cyber war practitioners & technology pioneers to break down the next era of conflict & defense strategy. nnSpeakers from the OODA network include: nn- Matt Devost, a successful entrepreneur with multiple exits & deep experience helping others succeed in national security & cybersecurity. nn- Bob Gourley, experienced enterprise technologist & intelligence professional who has successfully guided multiple startups in service to national security missions.nn- Nancy Morgan, former intelligence senior executive whose responsibilities included all IC AI policy. nn- Eileen Vidrine, experienced intelligence & technology executive with service across the IC & DoD. Former Chief Data & AI Officer for the US Air Force. nn- Michael Groen (LtGen, USMC Ret), intelligence professional who has served as Joint Staff director of intelligence & leader of the first DoD organization focused on AI for mission impact (JAIC).nnWell explore:n- The impact of deep tech on intelligence operations, military readiness, & geopolitical stabilityn- The rise of autonomous systems, cyber weapons, & AI-driven decision-makingn- The convergence of commercial & defense technology in the age of great power competitionn- What businesses & investors need to know about defense tech opportunities & risksnExpect sharp insights, candid assessments, & a no-BS look at where the world is headed & how to serve these missions today & tomorrow. This event is designed for those who think beyond the headlines & operate at the intersection of strategy, technology, & national security.nHigh-stakes insightscome prepared.

As emerging technologies accelerate at an unprecedented pace, how should policymakers, defense leaders, & the great builders in the private sector adapt to ensure strategic advantage?nJoin OODA at New York Deep Tech Week for an elite event featuring national security veterans, cyber war practitioners & technology pioneers to break down the next era of conflict & defense strategy. nnSpeakers from the OODA network include: nn- Matt Devost, a successful entrepreneur with multiple exits & deep experience helping others succeed in national security & cybersecurity. nn- Bob Gourley, experienced enterprise technologist & intelligence professional who has successfully guided multiple startups in service to national security missions.nn- Nancy Morgan, former intelligence senior executive whose responsibilities included all IC AI policy. nn- Eileen Vidrine, experienced intelligence & technology executive with service across the IC & DoD. Former Chief Data & AI Officer for the US Air Force. nn- Michael Groen (LtGen, USMC Ret), intelligence professional who has served as Joint Staff director of intelligence & leader of the first DoD organization focused on AI for mission impact (JAIC).nnWell explore:n- The impact of deep tech on intelligence operations, military readiness, & geopolitical stabilityn- The rise of autonomous systems, cyber weapons, & AI-driven decision-makingn- The convergence of commercial & defense technology in the age of great power competitionn- What businesses & investors need to know about defense tech opportunities & risksnExpect sharp insights, candid assessments, & a no-BS look at where the world is headed & how to serve these missions today & tomorrow. This event is designed for those who think beyond the headlines & operate at the intersection of strategy, technology, & national security.nHigh-stakes insightscome prepared.
