events.name: Sales Acceleration Night - Insights From Top Leaders
events.description: Join us for an exclusive after-work networking event designed for sales, startup, & GTM professionals at Datadog's offices in the New York Times Building. This evening will feature an insightful discussion on sales career growth & the evolving role of AI in the industry. Enjoy great conversations, valuable insights, & complimentary food & drinks. Why Attend?Gain valuable career insights from top sales & strategy leaders. Explore how AI is reshaping sales roles & future opportunities. Connect with like-minded professionals in an intimate, high-impact setting. Network with sales leaders, SV Academy alumni, & other professionals passionate about the tech industry. Experience awe-inspiring Views of NYC at an innovative tech pioneer. Meet the PanelistsMicah Steiger | Senior Director, Enterprise Sales at DatadogHardworking enterprise sales professional with experience selling complex, strategic technology contracts with Fortune 500 companies. Proven success in sales & strategy, growing pre-IPO startups, & forging mutually beneficial business partnerships. Jason Silverman | Enterprise Business Development & Strategic Initiatives Manager at PeekJason helps scale business development at Peek, a platform that has facilitated nearly $2 billion in experience bookings. Peek Pro provides industry-leading online booking, POS, & automation tools for experience operators-from Museum of Ice Cream to national parks-helping them drive revenue & streamline operations. Kelvin Low | GTM Revenue & Product Executive | Former McKinsey, X (Twitter), IndeedKelvin is an experienced revenue & product leader at Integral Ad Science (IAS), where he drives Go To Market strategy & product rollouts. He has scaled multiple B2B SaaS solutions, growing offerings from 0 to $100M+ ARR & expanding enterprise revenue from $3B to $6B. He has led global teams at startups & large firms like Indeed, Twitter, McKinsey, & Singapore Airlines. Agenda Wednesday, April 2nd 6:00 PM - Doors Open & Networking 6:30 PM - Welcome & Introduction 6:45 PM - Panel Discussion: Sales Careers & AI's Impact 7:30 PM - Q&A Session 8:00 PM - Networking Reception 9:00 PM - Event Close *Food & Drinks Provided! About BearworksBearworks is an AI-driven sales startup revolutionizing the way businesses close deals. Our intelligent, data-driven tools (such as parallel dialer, virtual salesfloor, & AI salescoach) empower teams to sell smarter, faster, & with greater precision.  RSVP now to secure your spot for an evening of insights, inspiration, & meaningful connections!

events.name: Carbon To Value C2V Initiative Showcase
events.description: Join us in New York City to celebrate Year 4 of the Carbon to Value Initiative! At this event, attendees will: Hear presentations from the C2V Year 4 Cohort of carbontech startups developing technology & business innovations to capture, convert, and/or sequester carbon Learn from carbontech experts through a fireside chat with Gregory Constantine, CEO & Co-founder of C2V alumni Air Company Have the opportunity to network with government, nonprofit, & corporate executives from the Carbontech Leadership Council (CLC) Meet with carbontech entrepreneurs, investors, & other climate champions Meet the startups shaping the future of carbontech as they each present their unique solutions, the progress they've made throughout the past six months of the C2V program, & where they are headed next:  Ardent is a process technology company that is developing membrane-based solutions for point-source carbon capture & other chemical separations. CarbonBlue develops a chemical process that mineralizes & extracts CO from water, which then reabsorbs more atmospheric CO. MacroCycle develops a chemical recycling process to turn polyethylene terephthalate (PET) & polyester-fiber waste into virgin-grade plastics. Maple Materials develops an electrolysis process to convert CO into graphite & oxygen. Oxylus Energy develops a direct electrochemical process to convert CO into fuels & chemical feedstocks, such as methanol. Phlair develops a renewable-energy-powered Direct Air Capture (DAC) system using an electrochemical process for acid & base generation. RenewCO is developing an electrochemical process to convert CO into fuels & chemicals, such as sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) or propylene glycol. Seabound builds carbon-capture equipment for new & existing ships. Secant Fuel develops a one-step electrocatalytic process that converts flue gas into syngas.

events.name: Scaling AI w/ Next Gen Energy Solns
events.description: Scaling AI with Next Generation Energy SolutionsArtificial Intelligence (AI) is growing at a fast pace with major technology companies announcing ambitious goals to scale over the coming years. The energy industry plays a pivotal role in enabling the AI expansion & infrastructure investments are required to fulfill the goals of the industry. In this session, we aim to explore how the growth ambitions of AI (like training large models & data center demands) is re-shaping energy consumption & how the energy & tech industries, along with public & private sectors, can innovate to handle the increased demand as AI scales globally. Can existing & emerging energy technology & infrastructure deliver the volume & reliability of power that AI requires? Are we equipped to empower AI's future, or will the energy demands handicap our ability to scale AI? PROGRAM:4:00 - 4:30 PM: Registration4:30 - 6:00 PM: Presentation & Discussion6:00 - 6:30 PM: Reception PanelistsChris Dendrinos, Clean Energy Equity Analyst, RBC Capital MarketsDaryl Kennedy, Vice President, STACK Infrastructure Moderated byMichael Tran, Managing Director & Head of Digital Research & Digital Intelligence Strategy, RBC Capital Markets

events.name: Quantonation - Physics Tech
events.description: Join us for lightning talks by world-class scientists & entrepreneurs exploring the frontiers of physics tech - quantum computing, high resolution ultrasound, quantum networks, thermodynamic processors & more. We'll also host a fireside chat to answer your questions about how quantum computing affects cybersecurity, blockchain, etc. Hosts:Will Zeng & Christophe Jurczak, Partners @Quantonation TalksWe'll have lightning talks from:- Faris Sbahi, CEO at Normal Computing (thermodynamic computing)- Arne Laucht, Head of Quantum Measurement at Diraq (silicon quantum computing)- Noel Goddard, CEO at Qunnect (quantum networks)- Vincent Hingot, CTO at ResolveStroke (higher resolution ultrasound)- Julien Lemyre, CEO at Nord Quantique (superconducting quantum computing) Fireside chat on quantum tech & cryptography with Michele Mosca, co-founder of EvolutionQ & world expert on quantum threats to cybersecurity. ToursThere will be tours available of Qunnect's quantum networking lab that is in the same building. About QuantonationQuantonation is an early stage venture capital fund investing globally in novel technologies based on advances in physics and/or computing.https://www.quantonation.com/ Location

events.name: Tech Mixer
events.description: + . NYC's largest & best networking mixer in the startup space is back. We call all tech founders, SaaS founders, entrepreneurs, recruiters, freelancers, startup mentors, coaches, & engineers for an evening of great connections & networking. Startup+ is New York City's premier startup community dedicated to fostering connections among entrepreneurs, investors, & innovators. Founded in 2021 during the pandemic, Startup+ has rapidly grown to include over 25,000 members passionate about driving innovation & building successful ventures. Startup+ has hosted over 6000 in-person attendees & conducted 12+ Pitch & 60+ networking events. Are you an entrepreneur looking to grow your startup? Are you interested in connecting with other like-minded individuals & organizations in the startup ecosystem? If so, you won't want to miss our upcoming startup networking event! Our event will be a great opportunity to network with potential investors, customers, partners, & mentors. Whether you're just starting out or you're an established entrepreneur, you'll find something valuable at this event. Why Attend? Expand Your Network: Meet & connect with influential people in the startup community. Gain Insights: Learn from the experiences & success stories of established entrepreneurs. Talk about your Idea: Present your ideas & get valuable feedback from investors & peers. Find Opportunities: Discover potential partners, mentors, & investors who can help you take your startup to the next level. What to bring? - Bring your business cards, if you have - Name tags will be provided - Our events are in reserved spaces with conversational music; make the most of it - Dress code is business casual Sponsorship Opportunities: We have exclusive sponsorship opportunities with different tiers, such as Gold, Silver, & Platinum, for those who want to tap into our events' expansive user base through our newsletter, meetup, Eventbrite, & other social media platforms. Please reach out to startupplus22@gmail.com for more information on the packages. Media/Press Opportunities: Startup+ was already featured in startup news, such as startups to follow. We are looking for more media coverage. Startup+ is a ground-level startup community without the backing of major banks or investor firms. We have grown to 25,000 members organically & hosted 120+ founders, 400+ investors, & several thousand general attendees in person. Media/Press folks looking to partner with us enjoy free entry to all our events. Please reach out to startupplus22@gmail.com to collaborate Volunteer Opportunities: Looking to attend our events for free? Volunteer with us & help us run the event. Your entry is on us. Please reach out to startupplus22@gmail.com to know details. Promotional Opportunities: Do you have a business proposal that is mutually beneficial to Startup+? For example, if you are a photography service looking to gain clients, Startup+ attendees like to get their photos taken. Write to startupplus22@gmail.com with your proposal. About Startup+ Startup+ is New York City's premier startup community dedicated to fostering connections among entrepreneurs, investors, & innovators. Founded in 2021 during the pandemic, Startup+ has rapidly grown to include over 25,000 members passionate about driving innovation & building successful ventures. Startup+ has hosted over 6000 in-person attendees & conducted 12+ Pitch & 60+ networking events. What We Offer In-Person Events: We host a wide range of events designed to connect & inspire. Our calendar saw 12+ pitch events & 60+ networking mixers, providing numerous opportunities for startups to showcase their ideas, gain feedback, & build meaningful relationships. Expert Insights: Members gain access to a wealth of knowledge from industry leaders. Our attracts experts who can give practical advice & insights into the latest trends & challenges in the startup world. Community Spotlights: We offer a platform for startups to gain visibility & connect with potential partners & investors. Connect with Us Connect with us via our newsletter to receive exclusive discounts, partner trials, & offers delivered to your email. Disclaimer By attending the events of Startup+ or Dev.Talks, you agree that the photos/videos taken during the event will be used to promote future events.

Whether you're just starting out or you're an established entrepreneur, you'll find something valuable at this event. Why Attend? Expand Your Network: Meet & connect with influential people in the startup community. Gain Insights: Learn from the experiences & success stories of established entrepreneurs. Talk about your Idea: Present your ideas & get valuable feedback from investors & peers. Find Opportunities: Discover potential partners, mentors, & investors who can help you take your startup to the next level. What to bring? - Bring your business cards, if you have - Name tags will be provided - Our events are in reserved spaces with conversational music; make the most of it - Dress code is business casual Sponsorship Opportunities: We have exclusive sponsorship opportunities with different tiers, such as Gold, Silver, & Platinum, for those who want to tap into our events' expansive user base through our newsletter, meetup, Eventbrite, & other social media platforms. Please reach out to startupplus22@gmail.com for more information on the packages. Media/Press Opportunities: Startup+ was already featured in startup news, such as startups to follow. We are looking for more media coverage. Startup+ is a ground-level startup community without the backing of major banks or investor firms. We have grown to 25,000 members organically & hosted 120+ founders, 400+ investors, & several thousand general attendees in person. Media/Press folks looking to partner with us enjoy free entry to all our events. Please reach out to startupplus22@gmail.com to collaborate Volunteer Opportunities: Looking to attend our events for free? Volunteer with us & help us run the event. Your entry is on us. Please reach out to startupplus22@gmail.com to know details. Promotional Opportunities: Do you have a business proposal that is mutually beneficial to Startup+? For example, if you are a photography service looking to gain clients, Startup+ attendees like to get their photos taken. Write to startupplus22@gmail.com with your proposal. About Startup+ Startup+ is New York City's premier startup community dedicated to fostering connections among entrepreneurs, investors, & innovators. Founded in 2021 during the pandemic, Startup+ has rapidly grown to include over 25,000 members passionate about driving innovation & building successful ventures. Startup+ has hosted over 6000 in-person attendees & conducted 12+ Pitch & 60+ networking events. What We Offer In-Person Events: We host a wide range of events designed to connect & inspire. Our calendar saw 12+ pitch events & 60+ networking mixers, providing numerous opportunities for startups to showcase their ideas, gain feedback, & build meaningful relationships. Expert Insights: Members gain access to a wealth of knowledge from industry leaders. Our attracts experts who can give practical advice & insights into the latest trends & challenges in the startup world. Community Spotlights: We offer a platform for startups to gain visibility & connect with potential partners & investors. Connect with Us Connect with us via our newsletter to receive exclusive discounts, partner trials, & offers delivered to your email. Disclaimer By attending the events of Startup+ or Dev.Talks, you agree that the photos/videos taken during the event will be used to promote future events.

events.name: Break Into Biotech Happy Hour
events.description: Join us to mix & mingle with Cohort 3 of Break into Biotech.  A great opportunity to meet industry professionals & explore opportunities in the rapidly growing NYC biotech sector. Heres a chance to make meaningful connections & explore pathways into the world of life sciences.nThis event is part of Genspace's Break into Biotech program, a groundbreaking workforce development initiative powered by the New York City Economic Development Corporation (NYCEDC). Join Break into Biotech's burgeoning bench scientists as they present their research on cutting-edge topics & techniques in biotechnology.nnAbout Break into BiotechnBreak into Biotech provides access to hands-on training, networking, mentorship, & career development opportunities necessary for learners to break into New York Citys rapidly growing biotechnology. As life sciences become the next innovation frontier, our goal is to ensure that all persons can explore & participate in this emerging bioeconomy. The program is open to all New Yorkers, including those who may not have a background in STEM but want to pursue employment in the life sciences ecosystem.nnAbout GenspacenGenspace is the world's first community biology lab  a place where people of all backgrounds can learn, create, & grow with the life sciences.nSince 2009, we have served the greater New York area by providing hands-on STEAM education programs for youth & adults, cultural & outreach events for the public, & a membership program to support New Yorks community of creatives, researchers, & entrepreneurs. Our programs demystify scientific processes, provide a platform for innovation, & cultivate the next generation of life sciences leaders in emerging global technologies, such as biotechnology, epidemiology, genomics, & many more.

events.name: Social Media Creators & Influencer Meetup
events.description: Hi there, fellow social media creators, influencers, brands & all people interested in New York. Welcome to our meetup! We at Social Rising organize regular events for you to connect, learn & grow, not only here but all over the world! We invite you to meet & engage in conversations with like-minded people both locally & in our worldwide community! First things first!: The best way to stay informed about our events is to join our newsletter at socialrising.com/join.If you're a creator with a significant audience, you will benefit the most from this newsletter at socialrising.com/join. You will be invited to public & exclusive events, & we will reach out to you with partner & job opportunities.If you want to help us creating our events: We're looking for 1-2 volunteers per event! Let us know if you're intersted through this form: https://socialrising.com/volunteer - we'll then reach out if we need you.What do participants & speakers think? "Matteo's meetups are incredible. Every time I come, I meet people who genuinely change my life. He somehow manages to get everyone involved, & the overall vibe is so nice. Can't wait for the next one!" - Dom (tech_wizzdom) "Matteo, thanks for the event yesterday. Its much better than other social media events that I have attended. Good work! So thanks!" Joe (via a Google Review) "What a fantastic group of people! If you are looking to connect with top-shelf digital communicators, Social Rising's meetups are perfect for that."- Oliver Aust - Founder, Investor, Bestselling Author, Podcast Host. "Matteo put on a killer event. Normally events are full of trivial, uncomfortable conversations, but I love Social Rising events, cool people & discussion points, & great locations", Digital Nomad Lifestyle. Our story In 2019 we started organizing meetups for creators & influencer in Berlin, & we became big fans of the people we brought together & the topics that were discussed. So we expanded to London early 2020, & as the pandemic started, we became a home for creators worldwide. Now, in 2023, we do our events in multiple cities & countries & are expanding to more & more countries. Wherever we are, influencers & creators connect, learn, & grow. Sometimes creators join us & share insights in lightning talks, & each time we all go home with new, interesting connections! Virtual events We have regular virtual meetups. Join your local meetup group (https://socialrising.com/meetup-groups) or follow our Eventbrite organizer dedicated to virtual events (https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/o/social-rising-virtual-34048034485). Current Social Rising events: New York #3 on January 13th, 2025San Francisco #2 on January 15th, 2025London #15 on January 21st, 2025Vienna #6 on February 11th, 2025Lisbon #4 on February 18th, 2025Bangkok on March 20th, 2025Stockholm #2 on May 8th, 2025What is this meetup for? Get to know new people in the social media spaceShare experiences with like-minded peopleListen to inspiring lightning talksBrainstorm & share ideas with fellow creatorsMotivating each otherFinding opportunities to work togetherDiscuss how to approach & reach chosen target groupsSometimes we have a product/brand presenting how they can support you... & of course: have a good time & grab a drink together!Your host Matteo Savio, CEO of Social Rising & Digital Ideas, hosts the event. As a digital marketer, he is consulting in B2B marketing & sales, & started Social Rising in 2019 as became fascinated by the topics & amazing people that showed up. He's enthusiastic ever since! Connect with him beforehand on LinkedIn! What next? Do you have experiences in growing and/or monetizing on Social Media? We'd love you to apply for a lightning talk: socialrising.com/lightning-talk.Are you interested in helping us creating our events? Help out as a volunteer: socialrising.com/volunteer.Follow us on Instagram & check out event images from past events: instagram.com/socialrisingevents.Especially as a brand or product you might be interested in following us on LinkedIn: linkedin.com/company/socialrisingevents.Does your product bring value to creators? Apply for a product presentation: socialrising.com/product-presentation.Join the meetup group closest to you here: https://socialrising.com/meetup-groups.See you at the event!Your Social Rising Team

events.name: Tools Of The Trade - Accessibility Without The Cost
events.description: This event will be online & in-person. The speaker & live stream starts at 7:30 pm ET. In-person attendees may arrive as early as 7 pm ET. DescriptionDiscover how to leverage free accessibility tools to create more inclusive digital experiences. This session will explore a variety of powerful, no-cost resources that help developers, designers, & content creators identify & resolve accessibility issues efficiently. Learn how to integrate these tools into your workflow, address common barriers, & ensure your projects are accessible to everyone. Whether you're new to accessibility or a seasoned pro, you'll walk away with actionable insights to enhance your work-without spending a dime. Attendees will gain: A curated list of the most effective free accessibility tools available.Practical strategies to incorporate these tools into your SDLC/workflow.Insights into addressing common accessibility barriers.Confidence to tackle accessibility challenges at any project stage.Key takeaways: Explore tools that analyze color contrast, keyboard navigation, & WCAG compliance.Learn how to test user interactions with free browser extensions & online platforms.Discover resources for improving accessible design & content creation.This session is ideal for professionals at any stage of their accessibility journey who want to maximize impact with minimal investment. There will be time for your questions. Presenter bioJeremy Rivera is a Developer Advocate for Deque Systems. He is a full-stack software engineer contributing to numerous open-source projects with a preference for JavaScript & Python-related technologies. He learned American Sign Language after high school & since then has been a friend to the Deaf community. Since then, he has participated in education work promoting literacy in the language. He joined Deque to continue to make the world an accessible place for people of all backgrounds. AccessibilityThe presentation will have human captions [CC], not automatic captions. There will be an ASL interpreter. For Aira Visual Interpreter access for the Blind & Low Vision community, download the Aira Explorer app on the Apple App Store or Google Play. For access in the physical space, the A11yNYC geofence should apply automatically. To access the online webinar for audio description, use the A11yNYC Access Offer to call, or simply inform your Visual Interpreter that you'd like that offer applied when you connect. Please let us know about any other accessibility requirements two weeks before the event. LivestreamView on YouTube. Provided by Internet Society Accessibility SIG. Location detailsThe event is on the 4th floor. Everyone must be accompanied to the event on the 4th floor. Because everyone needs to be escorted, please arrive early or on time. When you enter the ground floor, a representative from A11yNYC will be there to provide elevator access. Attendees can enter on the third floor & go up the staircase, or request accommodation to go directly to the 4th floor. Thanks to Ben Ogilvie for making this possible! Let us know if you're coming! The building is near several transit stops: 6 train Spring Street (non-accessible stop): 100 feetCanal Street (accessible stop): 0.4 milesNQRW trains Prince Street (non-accessible stop): 0.2 milesCanal Street (accessible stop): 0.3 milesM1 / M55 Bus lines Broadway/Spring Street stop: 500 feetCabs & rideshares can let passengers out right near the building entrance AccreditationAll A11yNYC meetups are pre-approved for IAAP Continuing Accessibility Education Credits (CAEC). SponsorsThanks to AKQA, Deque, Evinced, Equal Entry, & Fable for sponsoring. Want to be a sponsor? Contact meryl@equalentry.com

events.name: New York Tech & Beer
events.description: Join us for a fun & casual after-work happy hour at Amity Hall in Greenwich Village! Whether you're winding down after a busy day or looking to connect with fellow techies, Amity Hall's lively, laid-back vibe is the perfect spot. events.name: Frontier Physics
events.description: Presentations from the frontiers of theoretical & applied physics research on topics like Warp Drive Propulsion, Low-Energy Nuclear Reactions, Electrogravitics & contrarian models of General Relativity. nnSpeakers include:nSean McIntosh, founder of Foothold Labs is developing Low Energy Nuclear Reactions (LENR) based reactors for power generation on unmanned autonomous systems. The Foothold Labs' Bockris LENR reactor is hypothesized to convert axions into high energy photons in hydrogen loaded vacancy sites inside a nickel cathode.nGianna Matire, cofounder at Applied Physics & world-reknowned speaker on advancements in General Relativity enabling the production of faster-than-light Warp DrivesnJack Carter, presenting on an Overview of Einstein-Cartn Spin-Torsional Gravity, a model of general relativity in which black holes do not collapse t o a singularity but rebound into a flat expanding spacetime - like the universe we live in.nMore speakers to be announced soon.

events.name: Career Paths On Fire - How Tweaking HR Practices Supercharged Our Scaling Effort
events.description: A short case study from a software development company that redefined key HR processes & practices like career development paths, promotion & compensation process, performance appraisals & incentives/bonuses distribution as part of the Large Scale Scrum transformation journey. Learn how it affected the workforce culture & satisfaction & how HRs adjusted their role so they are praised & welcomed by teams. **About the speaker**:Georgiy enjoys sharing my experience with organizational design, leadership, agile management & modern software engineering to boost people's & company's potential. I believe that autonomous, self-organizing teams succeed because they have a greater sense of responsibility, can respond faster to change, & accelerate innovation. The people in these teams are happier & they in turn lead to happier customers. **How to connect with Georgiy**: [Georgiy Zhytar | LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/georgiy-zhytar/) Related content: Important Organizational Enablers of Deep Systemic Improvements (e.g. LeSS Adoption) - Coaching, Consulting, TrainingProduct Discovery & Business Agility Workshop - Coaching, Consulting, Training

events.name: Fireside Chat
events.description: Journalist, author, & host Kara Swisher takes her podcast, On with Kara Swisher, to The Cooper Union's Great Hall stage for one night only. Catch her live interview with Josh Johnson, correspondent for The Daily Show and, according to WIRED, the funniest guy on the internet. The pair will tackle the latest news in tech, politics, & business with searing wit & sharp insight. The On with Kara Swisher taping is free & open to the public. Registration on EventBrite is required. However, an EventBrite ticket does not guarantee entry as this is a first-come-first-served free event. Kara Swisher, whose early & no-holds-barred coverage of the technology industry earned her a reputation as Silicon Valley's most feared but revered journalist, is considered the top reporter in the tech game. Currently, she is host of On with Kara Swisher & co-host of the Pivot podcast, as well as editor-at-large of New York Magazine & a CNN contributor. She was named to The Hollywood Reporter's list of Podcast Power Players in 2022, 2023, & 2024, & to the 2023 Out 100, & she received the Pioneer Icon award at the 2023 iHeart Podcast Awards. Swisher co-founded the technology website, Recode, & tech conference, Code, which is the country's premier conference on tech & media. She's the author of the New York Times bestselling memoir, Burn Book: A Tech Love Story as well as aol.com: How Steve Case Beat Bill Gates, Nailed the Netheads & Made Millions in the War for the Web, & There Must Be a Pony in Here Somewhere: The AOL Time Warner Debacle & the Quest for a Digital Future. Paperback copies of Burn Book featuring a new afterword are now available wherever books are sold. Emmy-nominated writer, stand-up comedian, actor, & NAACP award-winner Josh Johnson is currently a correspondent on Comedy Central's Emmy & Peabody Award-winning program The Daily Show where he was previously a writer for the past seven years. Johnson is also a former writer & performer on NBC's The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, where he made his late-night debut in 2017. Johnson's most recent stand-up special, Josh Johnson: Up Here Killing Myself, premiered on Peacock in 2023 to rave reviews, touting Johnson as a naturally gifted story teller. A prolific writer & performer, Johnson puts out weekly stand-up sets on his YouTube channel. In the past year, he has released over 24 hours of stand-up, & the content on his YouTube channel has been viewed over 225 million times by people all over the world. You can currently see Josh all over the US on his FLOWERS TOUR.

events.name: Scaling Engg Orgs
events.description: Join our Engineering Leadership NYC event, in collaboration with Duolingo, dedicated to accelerating your career growth as an engineering leader. We offer engaging content, food, drinks, & time to network & get advice from your peers. This event will explore the essential aspects of sustainably growing engineering organizations. We will deep dive into: Designing & scaling engineering team structures, including organizational models & the transition from small to large teams. Engineering processes & execution at scale, covering tooling & practices, effective governance mechanisms, & communication models across teams. The role of culture in scaling an organization, highlighting the importance of recognizing organizational patterns. Agenda6:00 PM - Reception Check into the event, & enjoy food & drinks while networking with other engineering leaders. 6:30 PM - Lightning Talks Engage with two short 15 minute presentations on the event topic by: Severin Hacker - CTO & Co-founder @ Duolingo Tiani Jones - Consultant & Founder of Proper Science,. 7:25 PM - Panel Discussion + Live Q&A Deep dive into the topic of the event & direct your live questions to: Tiani Jones - Consultant & Founder of Proper Science,. Fabio Lessa - VP of Engineering @ Duolingo Tramale Turner - CTO @ Robin AI Jackie Balzer Austin - Director of Engineering @ Spotify Moderated by: Francisco Trindade - VP of Engineering @ Braze 8:10 PM - Networking Make new connections & continue the discussion with fellow leaders until 8:30pm. About Engineering Leadership NYCEngineering Leadership NYC is a community for Engineering Managers, Directors, VPs, & Staff+ Engineers working in the software industry. The organization hosts in-person events focused on fostering connections, sharing experiences, & building professional relationships. Through curated topics, panel discussions, & networking opportunities, we provide a space for leaders to navigate the challenges of engineering management & leadership together. Check out pictures of our events here. About DuolingoDuolingo is the most popular language-learning platform & the most downloaded education app worldwide. The app makes learning new languages fun with bite-sized lessons that feel like playing a game. The company's mission is to develop the best education in the world & make it universally available. Duolingo offers over 100 total courses across 40 distinct languages, from Spanish, French, German & Japanese to Navajo & Yiddish.

events.name: Professional Readiness Of LLMs In Financial Regulations
events.description: IAQF & Thalesians Seminar Series: Towards Professional Readiness of LLMs in Financial Regulations - A Seminar by Xiao-Yang Liu 6:00 PM Seminar Begins7:30 PM Reception Hybrid Event Location:Fordham UniversityMcNally Amphitheater140 West 62nd StreetNew York, NY 10023 Free Registration! For Virtual Attendees: Please email web@iaqf.org for the link. Abstract:In this talk, Xiao-Yang Liu will showcase their FinGPT--an open-source counterpart of BloombergGPT, on financial regulations. In particular, the team's two-year efforts on benchmarking financial large language models, with a zooming in Financial Regulations. He will also share ongoing projects in GenAI Research on Open Finance at Columbia University. The financial industry operates within a labyrinth of complex regulations & industry standards designed to maintain market integrity & ensure reliability in financial reporting & compliance processes. Intricate financial regulations & standards have presented significant challenges for financial professionals & organizations. Large language models (LLMs), such as GPT-4o, Llama 3.1, & DeepSeek's V3/R1 models, have shown remarkable capabilities in natural language understanding & generation, making them promising for applications in the financial sector. However, current LLMs face challenges in the domain of financial regulations & industry standards. These challenges include grasping specialized regulatory language, maintaining up-to-date knowledge of evolving regulations & industry standards, & ensuring interpretability & ethical considerations in their responses. Bio:Dr. Xiao-Yang Liu graduated in Electrical Engineering of Columbia University. He is part-time researcher at Lab GenAI Research on Open Finance, Columbia University, & a faculty member in RPI's CS department. His research interests include Reinforcement Learning, Large Language Models, Quantum Computing, & applications to finance. He created the popular open-source projects, FinGPT, FinRL, & ElegantRL.

events.name: AI In Marketing - Innovation, Impact & The Road Ahead
events.description: A Panel & Networking Event AI IN MARKETING:Innovation, Impact & the Road Ahead LIVE & ZOOM HYBRID EVENT Wed, Apr 9, 6:30-8:30 pm  130 E 59th St, 7th Fl., NYC   Join us for an engaging panel discussion on AI in Marketing. This dynamic event will bring together thought leaders & AI innovators to discuss how AI is reshaping the marketing landscape. Our speakers will share insights on leveraging AI to drive innovation, enhance customer experiences, & stay competitive & privacy-compliant in an ever-evolving marketplace. Key topics to be explored include: The transformative impact of AI on marketing, from automation to advanced consumer engagement across multiple channels. How businesses can harness AI for predictive analytics, decision-making, & scalable personalization to drive efficiency & growth. Strategies for measuring the ROI of AI in marketing, ensuring its value aligns with business objectives & cost-effectiveness. The evolving role of AI in creative marketing, highlighting the skills marketers need to stay competitive in an AI-driven landscape. Balancing AI-powered personalization with data privacy & regulatory compliance, ensuring ethical & responsible marketing practices. Future trends in AI-driven marketing, shaping business strategies, consumer interactions, & industry standards. MODERATOR: David Berkowitz - Moderator, Artificial Intelligence Marketer's Guild, Author The Non-Obvious Guide to AI Marketing,PANELISTS: Max Cammarota - Director, Performance Media, Beeby Clark+MeylerHikari Senju - CEO, Omneky (virtual) Amy Yeung - Exec in Residence, Progress Partners (virtual)Domenic Venuto - EVP, Chief of Product & Data, Horizon Media  DATE/TIME: Wednesday April 9, 2025; 6:00 pm - 9:00 pm LOCATION:  Virtual & LIVE at 130 E 59th St, 7th Floor, NYC FEE:  $35 for CBSACNY members; $45 for non members; Zoom participants will be sent the link 24 hours in advance of the event. For late registrants, the Zoom link will be sent 30 minutes in advance of the event. EVENT SCHEDULE: 6:30 PM - 6:45 PM: Check-In6:45 PM - 7:00 PM: Opening Remarks by Brad Jobling & Moderator David Berkowitz7:00 PM - 7:45 PM: Panel Discussion7:45 PM - 8:00 PM: Audience Q&A8:00 PM - 8:30 PM: Post Event NetworkingThis event was organized by the Club's AI Committee. If you'd like to help us plan more events by joining the Committee, please contact us for more info.  JOIN THE CBS ALUMNI CLUB: Get ONE FREE EVENT (including this one) with your new ($85 or more) membership.Click here to join now & then contact us to receive your promotional code before you register (sports, tours, etc., excluded).

events.name: Navigating The Tech Investment Landscape
events.description: Navigating the Tech Investment Landscape: A Conversation with Alok Sama & Max LevchinBusiness & Market Insights Join us for an insightful evening at Asia Society as Alok Sama, former President & CFO of Softbank Group International & author of the bestselling literary memoir The Money Trap: Lost Illusions Inside the Tech Bubble, engages in a compelling conversation with renowned fintech entrepreneur Max Levchin, co-founder of PayPal & founder-CEO of Affirm. They will share invaluable lessons from their extensive careers in tech & finance, delving into the current landscape of tech investment, exploring the impact of the present administration's tech vision, & the U.S.-China tech rivalry.  With Masayoshi Son leading President Trump's AI infrastructure investment project - Project Stargate - Mr. Sama has special insight into what to expect from the enigmatic "Masa," much of his experience also documented in his book The Money Trap. What is it that investors & innovators are not seeing? Or choosing not to see? Don't miss this opportunity to gain wisdom from some of the industry's giants in a thought-provoking discussion. The Money Trap will be available for sale during the event with a book signing to follow. SpeakersAlok SamaAlok Sama currently serves as a Senior Advisor to Warburg Pincus & Chairs the Advisory Board for Valhalla Ventures. While at SoftBank he led the $34 billion acquisition of Arm Holdings, the $59 billion merger of T-Mobile & Sprint & multiple growth investments across technology verticals. He has over 30 years of investment banking, capital market & investment experience in New York, London & Hong Kong. Prior to Softbank, he was a senior Managing Director at Morgan Stanley, where he led the firm's communications practice in Europe & the TMT practice in the Asia-Pacific region. He holds an MBA from The Wharton School & an MFA in Creative Writing from New York University. He is a member of the CNBC Global CFO Council, & a former Chairman of the London Chapter of the Young President's Organization Max Levchin  Max Levchin is the founder & CEO of Affirm, & the co-founder & Chairman of Glow, a data-driven fertility company. Max was one of the original co-founders of PayPal where he served as the Chief Technology Officer. Max also founded Slide, which was acquired by Google in 2010, & helped create Yelp, where he served as Chairman from 2005 until July 2015. Max was born in Kyiv (Ukraine) & holds a B.S. in Computer Science from University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. He is a serial entrepreneur, computer scientist, philanthropist & active investor in more than 100 startups.

events.name: Transforming Urban Waste - Policy, Innovation, & The Path To Sustainability
events.description: Waste management & treatment is an ever-growing issue, influenced by consumerism trends, continued urbanization, & rising public awareness. Tackling this issue will require significant innovative thinking, both from policymakers & the technological sector. Join the Research Program on Sustainability Policy & Management, the MS Program in Sustainability Management, the MS Program in Sustainability Science, & the MPA Program in Environmental Science & Policy for a conversation about the role of urban policy at the municipal, state, & federal levels, as well as new technological approaches in shaping effective solutions for the future of waste management in New York City & beyond. Moderator:  Dr. Steven Cohen is the Director of the Research Program on Sustainability Policy & Management at Columbia's Climate School. He is a Professor in the Practice of Public Affairs at the Columbia University School of International & Public Affairs (SIPA), the Senior Vice Dean at the Columbia University School of Professional Studies (SPS), & the Program Director of the M.S. in Sustainability Management program at SPS & the MPA in Environmental Science & Policy program at SIPA.  From 2006 to 2018, he was the Executive Director of Columbia University's Earth Institute.  Panel: Edward Grayson served as the 44th Commissioner of the New York City Department of Sanitation (DSNY) from 2020-2022. Commissioner Grayson began his career in 1999 as a Sanitation Worker & rose steadily through the ranks over his 23 years of service. In his tenure, he has developed, & implemented many programs, initiatives, & deployment strategies to foster the core values of the Department; Safety, Service & Sustainability." Founded in 1881, DSNY is the largest Municipal Agency of its kind in the world, serving the almost 8.5 million residents of NYC with distinction & collecting 12,000 tons of trash, recyclables, & compostable material every day.  Jamie Lowrey is the Director of Strategic Operations at Circular Services, where he leads projects to improve recycling facility performance & supports business growth across the recycling & organics divisions. He oversees facility upgrades that increase material recovery rates, develops data-driven KPI systems to measure success, & facilitates industry partnerships that advance practical sustainability goals. Jamie's work bridges day-to-day operations with high-level strategy, helping transform how materials recovery facilities adapt to changing waste streams & market demands in today's evolving environmental landscape. Samantha MacBride is an Adjunct Assistant Professor at the Marxe School of Public & International Affairs at Baruch College, CUNY.  Her research focuses on municipal operations, public management, & measurement & technology in environmental governance.  She worked for 25 years in sanitation & wastewater treatment & is now an Advisor to Earth Matter, a community compost organization in NYC. Dr. Christoph Meinrenken is an Associate Professor of Practice in Columbia's Faculty of Professional Studies, a Principal Investigator at the Climate School, the Academic Director of the M.S. degree in Information & Knowledge Strategy (IKNS), & an Affiliate of the Foundations of Data Science Center at the Data Science Institute. Meinrenken also co-chairs the Columbia University Seminar on Complexity Science, Modeling, & Sustainability. An expert in Life Cycle Assessment & enterprise-scale product analytics, he has worked with the World Resources Institute, Carbon Disclosure Project (CDP), & The Sustainability Consortium, & consulted several globally operating consumer goods manufacturers. Before joining Columbia in 2009, Meinrenken worked on modeling molecular spectra (MSE, Princeton University, 1996) & computational neuroscience (PhD Physics, Max Planck Institute, 2001). In addition to academic research & teaching, Meinrenken spent several years in the private sector, specializing in financial engineering & risk management.   Event program is available here. RECEPTION Light refreshments will be served at this event.  This event is free & open to the public.   Registration for all guests is recommended for this event & it closes on Monday, April 14.   ADDITIONAL INFORMATION For further information please contact Lili Csorba, lcsorba@climate.columbia.edu or Tal Henig-Hadar, thenig-hadar@climate.columbia.edu.     To obtain additional information about program offerings at Columbia University's School of Professional Studies, please contact an Admissions Counselor at inquire@sps.columbia.edu. If you require closed captioning, sign-language interpretation, or any other disability accommodations, please contact Disability Services, disability@columbia.edu, at least 10 days in advance. This event is open to individuals irrespective of identity & sex.

events.name: Trailblazers In Business
events.description: Join us at the Asia Society for an inspiring conversation with two of the most influential business trailblazers of our time, Sheila Lirio Marcelo & Indra Nooyi. This event will delve into their remarkable journeys, highlighting their groundbreaking achievements & the unique challenges they have faced. They will share their personal histories, professional milestones, & strategies that have defined their careers. The two speakers will also discuss the pivotal moments that shaped their paths, the obstacles they overcame, & the lessons they learned along the way. Don't miss this opportunity to hear from two titans who continue to inspire & pave the way for future generations as women of the Asian Diaspora. Vicky Nguyen, NBC News Daily Anchor will moderate the program. Anu Segal, founder of The Culture Tree, will provide closing remarks. Sheila Lirio Marcelo has more than 20 years of leadership experience in internet consumer marketplace businesses, including as the Co-Founder & Chief Executive Officer of Ohai.ai, a cutting-edge technology startup leveraging generative AI to improve the lives of families. She was a former Venture Partner at New Enterprise Associates & is a founding board member of The Asian American Foundation. She previously founded Care.com in 2006 & took it public in 2014; she was Chairwoman & CEO until early 2020, when the company was sold to IAC. She has been honored with numerous accolades. She was on Forbes 50 Over 50, she was one of Fortune's "Top 10 Women Entrepreneurs" & appeared at Fortune's Most Powerful Women Summit. She is a Henry Crown Fellow with the Aspen Institute, a Young Global Leader of the World Economic Forum, & a member of the Council on Foreign Relations. She earned a B.A. from Mount Holyoke College, which also conferred upon her an honorary Doctorate of Humane Letters in 2015. She has a J.D. & M.B.A. with honors from Harvard University. In 2014, Marcelo became the youngest recipient of the Harvard Business School Alumni Achievement Award. Indra Nooyi served as CEO & chairman of PepsiCo from 2006 to 2019. During her tenure, the company's shareholder returns exceeded that of the S&P 500. She served as a member of the PepsiCo Board of Directors from 2001 to February 2019. Today, she is a member of the board of Amazon, the supervisory board of Philips, a member of the International Advisory Council of Temasek, & a member of the Advisory Board of Apollo Investment. She is on the Dean's Advisory council at MIT's School of Engineering & also serves on the boards of the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, & the Board of Trustees of the National Gallery of Art. From 2019-2022, she served as the Class of 1951 Chair for the Study of Leadership at West Point where she worked with the Department of Behavioral Sciences & Leadership to fulfill the mission of character at the U.S. Military Academy. She was also co-chair of The Reopen Connecticut Advisory Group, developing recommendations & guidelines for reactivating the state's economy post-pandemic. She is the author of the book My Life in Full: Work, Family & Our Future, a memoir that offers insight & a call-to-action on how our society can blend work & family - & advance women - in the 21st century, a New York Times bestseller & available in multiple languages. She is the recipient of 18 honorary degrees. In 2007, the Government of India awarded her the Padma Bhushan, the country's 3rd highest civilian honor, & in that same year, named an Outstanding American by choice by the Department of Homeland Security/US Citizenship & Immigration Services. In 2019, her portrait was inducted into the Smithsonian National Portrait Gallery, & in 2022 she was inducted into the National Women's Hall of Fame. She is a member of the American Academy of Arts of Sciences, the New York Academy of Science, & the American Philosophical Society. She holds a B.S. from Madras Christian College, an M.B.A. from the Indian Institute of Management in Calcutta, & a Master of Public & Private Management from Yale University. Vicky Nguyen (moderator) is NBC News Daily Anchor & NBC News Chief Consumer Investigative Correspondent in New York. She is author of Boat Baby: A Memoir, which tells the story of her family's daring escape from communist Vietnam & her unlikely journey from refugee to reporter. She joined NBC News in April 2019 as the Investigative & Consumer correspondent, with her reporting been seen on The Today Show, 3rd Hour Today, Nightly News with Lester Holt, NBC News Now, & MSNBC. Prior to moving to New York, she worked the NBC Bay Area, KNTV in the San Francisco Bay Area. There she served as a senior investigative reporter for the NBC Bay Area Investigative Unit & Anchor of the Sunday evening news. Before joining NBC Bay Area, she worked at various television stations in Florida, Nevada, & Arizona. Anu Seghal is a children's author & the Founder/CEO of The Culture Tree, the largest cultural literacy & language education company for kids focusing on South Asia. Anu believes awareness of one's heritage, culture, & language is key for children to become self-aware & confident individuals. She holds an MBA from Yale University & has worked in the corporate sector for almost 15 years. She has received several awards & recognitions for her work in cultural literacy. Anu has written five books that represent stories & languages of India.

events.name: JLABS Investor & Partnering Day
events.description: Applications are now open for the 2025 JLABS Investor & Partnering Day, where science converges with strategic investment opportunities. Join us on Wednesday, May 7, 2025 at the New York Genome Center in New York City to connect with top investors in curated one-on-one meetings designed to spark potential partnerships. Attendees will also gain valuable insights on emerging trends in life science investment for the year ahead! With a highly competitive application process with limited spots, innovators aligned with the the J&J business areas of interest & affiliated platform technologies are encouraged to apply. This will increase the likelihood of acceptance. Don't miss your chance to be a part of this invitation-only gathering with industry leaders. Apply today to secure your spot by filling out the questionnaire & turn your groundbreaking ideas into reality! Applications must be completed by April 4, 2025. Are you ready to connect at the 2025 JLABS Investor & Partnering Day?Please note: This event has limited availability & is open only to biotech & life science startups seeking pre-seed, seed, or series A funding & located in the U.S. & Canada. Attending startups are only selected after additional screening. Please complete this application for consideration. Selected non-JLABS resident companies will be asked to complete a no-obligation application for JLABS residency. This will not be a commitment to become a JLABS resident company.

events.name: Data Science Salon - Applying AI & ML To Finance & Tech
events.description: Join us at Data Science Salon New York for an exclusive experience designed to connect you with the people you'd like to meet, without any surprises. Data Science Salon New York is an annual one-day conference, limited to vetted attendees, focused on using artificial intelligence & machine learning in the enterprise. This intimate event, a mix of TedEx, Foo Camp & Summit, curates data science sessions to bring senior managers, C-suite executives, & the most talented local AI/ML researchers face-to-face, fostering education & collaboration on innovative solutions in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive analytics, & best practices. Expect to walk away with actionable insights from those working on the frontlines of machine learning in the enterprise. Please note, all session footage will only be available to those who attend the event in person. About DSS New YorkData Science Salon New York is a one-day, invite-only experience for senior managers, C-suite executives, & top local AI/ML researchers. This exclusive event is all about networking & connecting you with the right people you want to meet. It features a curated mix of use-cases, technical talks, workshops, & Q&A sessions, designed to foster direct interaction & collaboration among industry leaders. Apply to attend & join us to gain actionable insights from those at the forefront of machine learning in the enterprise.

events.name: Cornell Tech @ Bloomberg w/ Flybridge Capital
events.description: **NOTE: This month's Cornell Tech @ Bloomberg event will be hosted at Bloomberg's 120 Park Avenue office. Please check the WHEN & WHERE section below for details.** Bloomberg, Cornell Tech, & Tech:NYC invite you to join us for the latest installment of the Cornell Tech @ Bloomberg Speaker Series, featuring Jesse Middleton, General Partner at Flybridge, in conversation with Isabelle Lee, Cross-Asset Reporter with Bloomberg News. Flybridge is an early-stage venture fund that backs ambitious founders building our AI future, & has invested in companies like MongoDB, FalconX, Nasuni, BitSight, Codecademy, Chief, & Zest AI - typically leading the seed rounds. Since joining Flybridge in 2016, Middleton has been instrumental in leading investments in companies such as Arcee, CarEdge, Chief, HiFi (acquired by Square), Imperfect Foods (acquired by Misfits Markets), Splice, & Teal. His investments focus on Full-Stack AI Native Applications, & he most recently created Next Wave NYC, a pre-seed fund that allows builders of iconic New York companies to back the next generation of founders in their community. Flybridge also recently released a founder-friendly, AI-powered investment memo generator. Jesse spotted the remote work revolution over a decade before the COVID-19 pandemic. He has turned his prescient market insights into extraordinary returns for founders & investors alike. As an early WeWork executive who helped scale the company to 4,000 employees across multiple continents, & later as an angel investor with a 16x portfolio multiple on invested capital (MOIC), Jesse has consistently supported transformative companies reshaping how we work, collaborate, & build community. We hope you'll register for the opportunity to attend this engaging conversation, in which Middleton will share insights from his extensive experience in venture capital & startups, discuss his vision for the future of work, & explore navigating the evolving tech landscape & the role of community in fostering innovation. Agenda5:30 PMNetworking reception begins 6:00 PMDoors close, conversation starts 6:45 PMAudience Q&A 7:00 PMNetworking & hors d'oeuvres to follow 7:45 PMFood service ends PLEASE NOTE: Seating is limited & registered attendees will be seated on a first-come, first-served basis. Doors close promptly at the top of the hour. Individuals arriving late may be turned away from the building. No walk-ins will be allowed.

events.name: Scaling Enterprise AI Agents - From 0 To Seed
events.description: Scaling Enterprise AI Agents: From 0 to Seed  Date: April 1st, 2025 |  Time: 5:30 PM - 7:30 PM Location: Comcast Ventures Office Capacity: Limited to 50 attendees Join Glasswing, Comcast, & Headline for an exclusive AI Agent Week panel featuring founders who are actively deploying AI agents in production. This discussion will dive into real-world applications, scaling challenges, & the future of AI agents in enterprise settings. Whether you're building, investing, or exploring AI agent use cases, this event will offer practical insights from those shaping the space. We'll also have drinks & light bites! What to Expect:  How AI agents are being used in production today Challenges & best practices for scaling AI-driven companies The best tech stacks for AI agent deployment Emerging trends & investment opportunities in the AI agent space Panelists & Moderator:  VC-backed startup founders leveraging AI agents for real impact: Britt O'Daly, CEO of Treater - Seed Stage AI agents to help consumer brands optimize retail sales by automating store-level engagement, ensuring products are stocked, promotions are executed, & revenue opportunities are maximized. Ethan Ding, CEO of TextQL - Seed Stage AI agents to enable translation of natural language queries into SQL, allowing users to interact with structured data using simple, conversational commands. Sarmad Qadri, CEO of Last Mile AI - Seed Stage Enables developers to build, deploy, & manage AI agents more efficiently by providing a streamlined platform for integrating models, data, & workflows into real-world applications.   Moderator: James Massaquoi, Senior Associate at Glasswing Ventures Hosted By: Glasswing Ventures, Comcast Ventures, & Headline  Limited spots available - secure your seat now! This is not the official AI Agent Week NYC event, but rather a CrewAI-hosted subsidiary gathering to connect, collaborate, & dive into the latest in AI agents. Expect insightful discussions, networking with like-minded professionals, & hands-on exploration of CrewAI's multi-agent systems. A huge thank you to the incredible sponsors who have made the main NYC event possible. Special appreciation goes to our Platinum Sponsors : Amazon Cloudera CapGemini Deloitte PwC And to our Gold Sponsors: Arize Brex Centrilogic CopilotKit Groq #nyc #newyork #ai

events.name: Insurtech Conference
events.description: About the InsurTech ConferenceJoin us at the 6th annual InsurTech Conference held on April 2-3, 2025.This InsurTech Conference will bring together traditional insurers, InsurTechs, investors, & other solution providers to support the InsurTech community. Presentations will be divided into two content areas: (1) Property & Casualty & (2) Life & Health.  Integrated in the event is the largest InsurTech Competition on the East Coast. The Top Ten startups from a pool of 100+ applicants will pitch in front of investors. Location: Pier 60 - Chelsea Piers, New YorkNetworking app for all attendees provided via brella.io. Why Attend?InsurTech Spring Conference brings together influencers & changemakers in the industry. Exclusive Access: Discover the latest tech & business models that are reshaping the insurance landscape. Networking Opportunities: Connect with industry leaders, potential partners, & thought leaders who are pushing the boundaries of what's possible. Expert Insights: Gain valuable knowledge from sessions led by top experts in the field, tailored to your specific interests in Property & Casualty or Life & Health.
